Peter Blackburn|||B-PER I-PER
BRUSSELS 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
The European Commission said on Thursday it disagreed with German advice to consumers to shun British lamb until scientists determine whether mad cow disease can be transmitted to sheep .|||O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" We do n't support any such recommendation because we do n't see any grounds for it , " the Commission 's chief spokesman Nikolaus van der Pas told a news briefing .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER O O O O O
He said further scientific study was required and if it was found that action was needed it should be taken by the European Union .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O
He said a proposal last month by EU Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler to ban sheep brains , spleens and spinal cords from the human and animal food chains was a highly specific and precautionary move to protect human health .|||O O O O O O O B-ORG O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Fischler proposed EU-wide measures after reports from Britain and France that under laboratory conditions sheep could contract Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy ( BSE ) -- mad cow disease .|||B-PER O B-MISC O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O B-MISC O O O O O O
But Fischler agreed to review his proposal after the EU 's standing veterinary committee , mational animal health officials , questioned if such action was justified as there was only a slight risk to human health .|||O B-PER O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Spanish Farm Minister Loyola de Palacio had earlier accused Fischler at an EU farm ministers ' meeting of causing unjustified alarm through " dangerous generalisation . "|||B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER I-PER O O O B-PER O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The EU 's scientific veterinary and multidisciplinary committees are due to re-examine the issue early next month and make recommendations to the senior veterinary officials .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sheep have long been known to contract scrapie , a brain-wasting disease similar to BSE which is believed to have been transferred to cattle through feed containing animal waste .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" What we have to be extremely careful of is how other countries are going to take Germany 's lead , " Welsh National Farmers ' Union ( NFU ) chairman John Lloyd Jones said on BBC radio .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O B-PER I-PER I-PER O O B-ORG I-ORG O
Germany imported 47,600 sheep from Britain last year , nearly half of total imports .|||B-LOC O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O

FRANKFURT 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
German first-time registrations of motor vehicles jumped 14.2 percent in July this year from the year-earlier period , the Federal office for motor vehicles said on Thursday .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O
The figures represent a 13.6 percent increase for passenger cars and a 2.2 percent decline for trucks from July 1995 .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The growth was partly due to an increased number of Germans buying German cars abroad , while manufacturers said that domestic demand was weak , the federal office said .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Almost all German car manufacturers posted gains in registration numbers in the period .|||O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O
Third was Ford with 35,563 registrations , or 11.7 percent .|||O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O
Only Seat and Porsche had fewer registrations in July 1996 compared to last year 's July .|||O B-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Seat posted 3,420 registrations compared with 5522 registrations in July a year earlier .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Porsche 's registrations fell to 554 from 643 .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O

" It appears to me the Syrian priority is still to negotiate .|||O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O

Rabinovich is winding up his term as ambassador .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O

Well repairs to lift Heidrun oil output - Statoil .|||O O O O B-LOC O O O B-ORG O
Three plugged water injection wells on the Heidrun oilfield off mid-Norway will be reopened over the next month , operator Den Norske Stats Oljeselskap AS ( Statoil ) said on Thursday .|||O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O
The plugged wells have accounted for a dip of 30,000 barrels per day ( bpd ) in Heidrun output to roughly 220,000 bpd , according to the company 's Status Weekly newsletter .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O

Finnish April trade surplus 3.8 billion markka - NCB .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O B-ORG O
HELSINKI 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
The value of exports fell one percent year-on-year in April and the value of imports fell two percent , NCB said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O
Trade balance ( million markka ) :|||O O O O O O O
April ' 96 March ' 96 Jan-April ' 96 Jan-April ' 95|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
Imports 10,663 10,725 43,430 40,989|||O O O O O
The January-April 1995 import figure was revised from 39,584 million markka and the export figure from 55,627 million markka .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Bank of Finland earlier estimated the April trade surplus at 3.2 billion markka with exports projected at 14.5 billion and imports at 11.3 billion .|||O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

-- Amsterdam newsroom +31 20 504 5000|||O B-LOC O O O O O
German farm ministry tells consumers to avoid British mutton .|||B-MISC O O O O O O B-MISC O O
BONN 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
Germany 's Agriculture Ministry suggested on Wednesday that consumers avoid eating meat from British sheep until scientists determine whether mad cow disease can be transmitted to the animals .|||B-LOC O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Until this is cleared up by the European Union 's scientific panels -- and we have asked this to be done as quickly as possible -- ( consumers ) should if at all possible give preference to sheepmeat from other countries , " ministry official Werner Zwingmann told ZDF television .|||O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-ORG O O
" I do not want to say that there is a concrete danger for consumers , " he added . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There are too many holes in what we know , and these must be filled very quickly . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bonn has led efforts to ensure consumer protection tops the list of priorities in dealing with the mad cow crisis , which erupted in March when Britain acknowledged humans could contract a similar illness by eating contaminated beef .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O
EU Farm Commissioner Franz Fischler had proposed banning sheep brains , spleens and spinal cords from the human and animal food chains after reports from Britain and France that under laboratory conditions sheep could contract Bovine Spongiform Encephalopathy ( BSE ) -- mad cow disease .|||B-ORG O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O B-MISC O O O O O O
The question is being studied separately by two EU scientific committees .|||O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O
Sheep have long been known to contract scrapie , a similar brain-wasting disease to BSE which is believed to have been transferred to cattle through feed containing animal waste .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
British officials say sheep meat is perfectly safe to eat .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O
It brought in 4,275 tonnes of British mutton , some 10 percent of overall imports .|||O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O
EU leaders agreed at a summit in June to a progressive lifting of the ban as Britain takes parallel measures to eradicate the disease .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

HORSE RACING - PIVOTAL ENDS 25-YEAR WAIT FOR TRAINER PRESCOTT .|||O O O B-PER O O O O O B-PER O
YORK , England 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
Sir Mark Prescott landed his first group one victory in 25 years as a trainer when his top sprinter Pivotal , a 100-30 chance , won the Nunthorpe Stakes on Thursday .|||O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O
Hever Golf Rose ( 11-4 ) , last year 's Prix de l ' Abbaye winner at Longchamp , finished third , a further one and a quarter lengths away with the 7-4 favourite Mind Games in fourth .|||B-PER I-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O
Pivotal , a Royal Ascot winner in June , may now be aimed at this season 's Abbaye , Europe 's top sprint race .|||B-PER O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-LOC O O O O O
Prescott , reluctant to go into the winner 's enclosure until the result of the photo-finish was announced , said : " Twenty-five years and I have never been there so I thought I had better wait a bit longer . "|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He added : " It 's very sad to beat Henry Candy because I am godfather to his daughter . "|||O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O
Berry said : " I`m disappointed but I do n't feel suicidal .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
He ( Mind Games ) was going as well as any of them one and a half furlongs ( 300 metres ) out but he just did n't quicken . "|||O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

SOCCER - DALGLISH SAD OVER BLACKBURN PARTING .|||O O B-PER O O B-ORG O O
LONDON 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
Blackburn announced on Wednesday they and Dalglish had parted by mutual consent .|||B-ORG O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O
But the ex-manager confessed on Thursday to being " sad " at leaving after taking Blackburn from the second division to the premier league title inside three and a half years .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a telephone call to a local newspaper from his holiday home in Spain , Dalglish said : " We came to the same opinion , albeit the club came to it a little bit earlier than me . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He added : " If no one asked , I never opened my mouth .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I have stayed out of the way and let them get on with the job .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The club thought it ( the job ) had run its course and I came to the same conclusion . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dalglish had been with Blackburn for nearly five years , first as manager and then , for the past 15 months , as director of football .|||B-PER O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

TENNIS - NEWCOMBE PONDERS HIS DAVIS CUP FUTURE .|||O O B-PER O O B-MISC I-MISC O O
SYDNEY 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
The former Wimbledon champion said the immediate future of Australia 's Davis Cup coach Tony Roche could also be determined by events in Split .|||O O B-MISC O O O O O O B-LOC O B-MISC I-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-LOC O
" If we lose this one , Tony and I will have to have a good look at giving someone else a go , " Newcombe was quoted as saying in Sydney 's Daily Telegraph newspaper .|||O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O B-LOC O B-ORG I-ORG O O
Under Newcombe 's leadership , Australia were relegated from the elite world group last year , the first time the 26-time Davis Cup winners had slipped from the top rank .|||O B-PER O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O
Newcombe has selected Wimbledon semifinalist Jason Stoltenberg , Patrick Rafter , Mark Philippoussis , and Olympic doubles champions Todd Woodbridge and Mark Woodforde to face the Croatians .|||B-PER O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O B-MISC O
The home side boasts world number six Goran Ivanisevic , and Newcombe conceded his players would be hard-pressed to beat the Croatian number one .|||O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O
" We are ready to fight to our last breath -- Australia must play at its absolute best to win , " said Newcombe , who described the tie as the toughest he has faced as captain .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Australia last won the Davis Cup in 1986 , but they were beaten finalists against Germany three years ago under Fraser 's guidance .|||B-LOC O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-PER O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

BASEBALL - ORIOLES ' MANAGER DAVEY JOHNSON HOSPITALIZED .|||O O B-ORG O O B-PER I-PER O O
BALTIMORE 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
Baltimore Orioles manager Davey Johnson will miss Thursday night 's game against the Seattle Mariners after being admitted to a hospital with an irregular heartbeat .|||B-ORG I-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O
" He is in no danger and will be treated and observed this evening , " said Orioles team physician Dr. William Goldiner , adding that Johnson is expected to be released on Friday .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O B-PER I-PER O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O
Orioles ' bench coach Andy Etchebarren will manage the club in Johnson 's absence .|||B-ORG O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-PER O O O
Johnson , who played eight seasons in Baltimore , was named Orioles manager in the off-season replacing Phil Regan .|||B-PER O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-ORG O O O O O B-PER I-PER O
He led the Cincinnati Reds to the National League Championship Series last year and guided the New York Mets to a World Series championship in 1986 .|||O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O
Baltimore has won 16 of its last 22 games to pull within five games of the slumping New York Yankees in the American League East Division .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O
-DOCSTART-|||O

BASEBALL - GREER HOMER IN 10TH LIFTS TEXAS PAST INDIANS .|||O O B-PER O O O O B-ORG O B-ORG O
CLEVELAND 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
Rusty Greer 's two-run homer in the top of the 10th inning rallied the Texas Rangers to a 10-8 victory over the Cleveland Indians Wednesday in the rubber game of a three-game series between division leaders .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" It was an off-speed pitch and I just tried to get a good swing on it and put it in play , " Greer said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
This was a big game .|||O O O O O O
The Rangers have won 10 of their last 12 games and six of nine meetings against the Indians this season .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O
The American League Western leaders have won eight of 15 games at Jacobs Field , joining the Yankees as the only teams with a winning record at the A.L. Central leaders ' home .|||O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O
Cleveland lost for just the second time in six games .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O
Ed Vosberg ( 1-0 ) blew his first save opportunity but got the win , allowing three hits with two walks and three strikeouts in 1 2/3 scoreless innings .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Baltimore , Cal Ripken had four hits and snapped a fifth-inning tie with a solo homer and Bobby Bonilla added a three-run shot in the seventh to power the surging Orioles to a 10-5 victory over the Seattle Mariners .|||O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O
The Mariners scored four runs in the top of the fifth to tie the game 5-5 but Ripken led off the bottom of the inning with his 21st homer off starter Sterling Hitchcock ( 12-6 ) .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O
Bonilla 's blast was the first time Randy Johnson , last season 's Cy Young winner , allowed a run in five relief appearances since coming off the disabled list on August 6 .|||B-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Baltimore has won seven of nine and 16 of its last 22 and cut the Yankees ' lead in the A.L. East to five games .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O
Alex Rodriguez had two homers and four RBI for the Mariners , who have dropped three in a row and 11 of 15 .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-MISC O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He became the fifth shortstop in major-league history to hit 30 homers in a season and the first since Ripken hit 34 in 1991 .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O
Dickson allowed a homer to Derek Jeter on his first major-league pitch but settled down .|||B-PER O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O
Jimmy Key ( 9-10 ) took the loss as the Yankees lost their ninth in 14 games .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O
They stranded 11 baserunners .|||O O O O O
In Boston , Mike Stanley 's bases-loaded two-run single snapped an eighth-inning tie and gave the Red Sox their third straight win , 6-4 over the Oakland Athletics .|||O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O
Stanley owns a .367 career batting average with the bases loaded ( 33-for-90 ) .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Tigers have won consecutive games after dropping eight in a row , but have won nine of their last 12 at home .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The White Sox have lost six of their last eight games .|||O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O

In Home Health to appeal payment denial .|||B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O
MINNETONKA , Minn .|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
In Home Health Inc said on Thursday it will appeal to the U.S. Federal District Court in Minneapolis a decision by the Health Care Financing Administration ( HCFA ) that denied reimbursement of certain costs under Medicaid .|||B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-LOC O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O O O B-MISC O
The HCFA Administrator reversed a previously favorable decision regarding the reimbursement of costs related to the company 's community liaison personnel , it added .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The company said it continues to believe the majority of the community liaison costs are coverable under the terms of the Medicare program .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O
" We are disappointed with the administrator 's decision but we continue to be optimistic regarding an ultimate favorable resolution , " Mark Gildea , chief executive officer , said in a statement .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O
Separately , In Home Health said the U.S. District Court in Minneapolis ruled in its favor regarding the reimbursement of certain interest expenses .|||O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O
This decision will result in the reimbursement by Medicare of $ 81,000 in disputed costs .|||O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O
" This is our first decision in federal distrct court regarding a dispute with Medicare , " Gildea said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-PER O O O
We are extremely pleased with this decision and we recognize it as a significant step toward resolution of our outstanding Medicare disputes . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O
-- Chicago Newsdesk 312-408-8787|||O B-ORG I-ORG O

Best sees Q2 loss similar to Q1 loss .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O
RICHMOND , Va .|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
1996-08-22|||O
He also told Reuters before the retailer 's annual meeting that the second quarter could be better than the first quarter ended May 4 . "|||O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We could do even better , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O
The second-quarter results are expected to be released in September .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
Best emerged from Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in June 1994 after 3-1/2 years .|||B-ORG O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O
" Bankruptcy is always possible , particularly when you lose what we are going to lose in the first half of this year , " Levy said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
But this is not something we are striving to do . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Richmond-based retailer lost $ 95.7 million in the fiscal year ended February 3 .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
That was the second-largest loss in the company 's history .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
The company announced in March that it was closing seven stores and backing out of nine new lease agreements .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At the time , Best said it did not plan to open any new stores this fall .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For last year 's second quarter , which ended July 29 , 1995 , Best posted a loss of $ 7.1 million , or $ 0.23 per share , on sales of $ 311.9 million .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
LONDON 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
Women who get measles while pregnant may have babies at higher risk of Crohn 's disease , a debilitating bowel disorder , researchers said on Friday .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Three out of four Swedish babies born to mothers who caught measles developed serious cases of Crohn 's disease , the researchers said .|||O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O
Dr Andrew Wakefield of the Royal Free Hospital School of Medicine and colleagues screened 25,000 babies delivered at University Hospital , Uppsala , between 1940 and 1949 .|||O B-PER I-PER O O B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O
Four of the mothers had measles while pregnant .|||O O O O O O O O O
" Three of the four children had Crohn 's disease , " Wakefield 's group wrote in the Lancet medical journal .|||O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O B-PER O O O O O B-ORG O O O
Crohn 's is an inflammation of the bowel that can sometimes require surgery .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It causes diarrhoea , abdominal pain and weight loss .|||O O O O O O O O O O
The researchers said the three children involved had especially severe cases .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O

Garlic pills do n't lower cholesterol , study finds .|||O O O O O O O O O O
LONDON 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
Garlic pills may not lower blood cholesterol and studies that show they do may be flawed , British researchers have reported .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O
There were no significant differences between the groups receiving garlic and placebo , " they wrote in the Journal of the Royal College of Physicians .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O
The researchers said this would make their findings more accurate .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
But the Oxford team disputed these findings and said either previous trials may have been interpreted incorrectly , those taking part were not given special diets beforehand or the duration of the studies may have been too short .|||O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7950|||O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
LONDON 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
The volcano in the Soufriere hills has erupted three times in the past 13 months and last April some 4,500 people living in the capital , Plymouth , and southern areas were evacuated to the north , where many are living in public shelters and schools .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Britain gave 8.5 million pounds ( $ 13 million ) to Montserrat , which is one of its dependent territories , when the volcano first became active .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Overseas Development Minister Lynda Chalker said a recent census had shown most Montserratians wanted to remain on the island . "|||O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O
The development of the north will help them to do just that , " she said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tennis - Philippoussis looms for Sampras in U.S. Open .|||O O B-PER O O B-PER O B-MISC I-MISC O
Wednesday 's U.S. Open draw ceremony revealed that both title holders should run into their first serious opposition in the third round .|||O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Looming in Sampras 's future is a likely third-round date with recent nemesis Mark Philippoussis , the rising Australian who took out Sampras in the third round of the Australian Open in January .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O B-MISC O O O B-PER O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O
Sampras avenged that defeat with a straight sets win over the 19-year-old power hitter in the second round at Wimbledon and their rubber match in New York could provide some first-week fireworks .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O
There will be no repeat of last year 's men 's final with eighth-ranked Andre Agassi landing in Sampras 's half of the draw .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-PER O O O O O O

TORONTO 1996-08-21|||B-LOC O
Top-seeded Thomas Muster of Austria was beaten 6-3 7-5 by 123rd-ranked Daniel Nestor of Canada on Wednesday in his first match of the $ 2 million Canadian Open .|||O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O
A lefthander with a strong serve , Nestor kept the rallies short by constantly attacking the net and the tactic worked in the second-round match against Muster , playing his first match after receiving a first-round bye along with the other top eight seeds .|||O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The tournament also lost its second seed on the third day of play when second-seeded Goran Ivanisevic of Croatia was beaten 6-7(3-7 ) 6-4 6-4 by unseeded Mikael Tillstrom of Sweden .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O
Eighth seed Marc Rosset of Switzerland was eliminated in a one hour , 55 minute battle by unseeded Mark Philippoussis of Australia .|||O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O
He held one match point at 9-8 in a marathon third-set tie break but was beaten 5-7 7-6 ( 7-1 ) 7-6 ( 13-11 ) by unseeded Daniel Vacek of the Czech Republic .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-LOC I-LOC O

There were only two service breaks in the match .|||O O O O O O O O O O
" I probably did n't hit five ground strokes in the whole match , " said Muster , only partly joking . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O
The way he was chipping and charging and serving and volleying I did n't really get my timing playing from the baseline . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" He played a good match , took a few chances , and every time he was down he was able to come up with a big first serve . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I do n't like playing under the lights but maybe it would not have made any difference . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ivanisevic rallied from a 2-5 deficit in the first set but then played erratically against the 44th-ranked Tillstrom , who was a surprise winner over his famous compatriot Stefan Edberg in the second round at Wimbledon .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-LOC O
Ivanisevic hit 32 aces but was outplayed from the back court by the 24-year-old Tillstrom .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O
The sixth-ranked Ivanisevic , who lost in the final at Indianapolis to world number one Pete Sampras of the U.S. last Sunday , made a quick getaway after his loss but did say : " Something was not there when I arrived ( in Toronto ) .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O
And I did n't have a good feeling as soon as I lost in my doubles ( on Tuesday ) . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" I thought he looked a little unfocused at certain times on his ground strokes , " said Tillstrom .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O

Malu replaced another Nigerian major general , John Inienger , who told officers at the handover ceremony that peace was now at hand for Liberia after six years of fighting and more than a dozen failed accords .|||B-PER O O B-MISC O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peacekeepers were harassed , killed and taken hostage , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" It is difficult but I want to assure you that peace is in sight . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

They finally went ahead with an escort from the ULIMO-J faction .|||O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O

The West African state of Guinea declared Thursday and Friday days of national prayer .|||O B-MISC I-MISC O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O
A government statement , broadcast repeatedly by state radio , said the two days of prayer were " for the dead , for peace and prosperity in Guinea , the victory of the new government and the health of the head of state " .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The precise reason for the call was not immediately clear .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
Guinea 's president , Lansana Conte , vice-president of the Organisation of the Islamic Conference , left for Kuwait on August 16 to prepare the next OIC summit in Pakistan in 1997 .|||B-LOC O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-ORG O O B-LOC O O O

Conte , an army general , survived a February army pay revolt which at the time he described as a veiled attempt to topple him .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He has since named a prime minister for the first time since early in his rule and ordered a crackdown on corruption .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Conte seized power in 1984 after the death of veteran Marxist leader Ahmed Sekou Toure .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER I-PER O
He won elections in 1993 .|||O O O O O O

BOGOTA , Colombia 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
Colombia 's Coast Guard on Thursday rescued 12 people lost for three days in an open boat off the Pacific coast , officials said .|||B-LOC O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O
The boat had been missing since Monday afternoon when it left the tiny island of Gorgona off Colombia 's southwest coast with sightseers for a return trip to Narino province , near the border with Ecuador .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-LOC O

The boat was towed to the port city of Buenaventura .|||O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O

LIMA , Peru 1996-08-21|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
Peruvian guerrillas killed one man and took eight people hostage after taking over a village in the country 's northeastern jungle region , anti- terrorist police sources said on Wednesday .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Some guerrillas made villagers listen to propaganda speeches in the village centre , others forced passing motorists out of their cars and daubed their vehicles with slogans .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
By Wednesday , the whereabouts of the eight hostages was still not known , the sources said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In recent months the Shining Path , severely weakened since the 1992 capture of its leader Abimael Guzman , has been stepping up both its military and propaganda activities .|||O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
Peru 's guerrilla conflicts have cost at least 30,000 lives and $ 25 billion in damage to infrastructure since 1980 .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Defiant U.S. neo-Nazi jailed by German court .|||O B-LOC B-MISC O O B-MISC O O
Andrew Gray|||B-PER I-PER
A Hamburg court sentenced U.S. neo-Nazi leader Gary Lauck on Thursday to four years in prison for pumping banned extremist propaganda into Germany from his base in the United States .|||O B-LOC O O B-LOC B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
Lauck , from Lincoln , Nebraska , yelled a tirade of abuse at the court after his conviction for inciting racial hatred .|||B-PER O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" The struggle will go on , " the 43-year-old shouted in German before being escorted out by security guards .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O
Lauck 's worldwide network has been the main source of anti-Semitic propaganda material flowing into Germany since the 1970s .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O B-LOC O O O O
said Bertram , who also read out extracts from Lauck 's material praising Hitler as " the greatest of all leaders " and describing the Nazi slaughter of millions of Jews as a myth .|||O B-PER O O O O O O O B-PER O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O B-MISC O O O O
Eager to put Lauck behind bars quickly and avoid a long and complex trial , prosecutor Bernd Mauruschat limited his charges to offences since 1994 .|||O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O
Interior Minister Manfred Kanther said in a statement he " welcomed the prosecution and conviction of one of the ringleaders of international neo-Nazism and biggest distributers of vicious racist publications " .|||O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O
" It is high time he was behind bars , " the opposition Social Democrats said in a statement .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O
Lauck , dressed in a sober blue suit and sporting his trademark Hitleresque black moustache , showed no sign of emotion as Bertram spent more than an hour reading out the verdict and explaining the court 's decision .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But as Lauck was about to be led away , he turned to reporters and blurted out a virtually incomprehensible quick-fire diatribe against the court .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Neither the National Socialists ( Nazis ) nor the communists dared to kidnap an American citizen , " he shouted , in an oblique reference to his extradition to Germany from Denmark . "|||O O O B-MISC I-MISC O B-MISC O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O
That 's the truth . "|||O O O O O O
His attorney , Hans-Otto Sieg , told reporters outside the courtroom that the judges had not explained how a German court could judge someone for actions carried out in the United States .|||O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
Bertram said Lauck was obsessed by Nazism and devoted his life to leading his National Socialist German Workers ' Party Foreign Organisation ( NSDAP-AO ) , which derives its name from the full German title of Hitler 's Nazi party .|||B-PER O B-PER O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-PER O B-MISC O O
During the three-month trial , the court dealt mainly with issues of the NSDAP-AO 's " NS Kampfruf " ( " National Socialist Battle Cry " ) magazine , filled with references to Aryan supremacy and defamatory statements about Jews .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O B-MISC O
The court rejected Sieg 's argument that Lauck 's extradition from Denmark , where he was arrested in March last year at the request of German authorities , was illegal .|||O O O B-PER O O O B-PER O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O
He will probably be free in around two and a half years .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O

India says sees no arms race with China , Pakistan .|||B-LOC O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O
NEW DELHI 1996-08-22|||B-LOC I-LOC O
India said on Thursday that its opposition to a global nuclear test ban treaty did not mean New Delhi intended to enter into an arms race with neighbouring Pakistan and China .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O
Foreign Minister I.K. Gujral was asked at a news conference if India 's decision to block adoption of the accord in Geneva would lead to an arms race with Pakistan and China .|||O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O
" I do n't see that possibility because India is not entering into any arms race , " he said . "|||O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Our not signing a new treaty does not mean we are going in for any new kind of weapons , particularly nuclear . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
China , along with Britain , France , Russia and the United States , is a declared nuclear power .|||B-LOC O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O B-LOC O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O
Experts believe both India and Pakistan could quickly assemble nuclear weapons .|||O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O
Gujral said he did not expect India 's veto of the Comprehensive Test Ban Treaty ( CTBT ) to damage bilateral ties with other nations .|||B-PER O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O
" I do not visualise its straining our bilateral relations with any country .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The text has already been blocked , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
Gujral said India would re-examine its position if the treaty , particularly a clause providing for its entry into force , was modified .|||B-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Asked what India would do if the pact were forwarded to the United Nations General Assembly , Gujral said : " That bridge I will cross when I come to it . "|||O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a written statement released at the news conference , Gujral reiterated India 's objections to the treaty , under negotiation at the Conference on Disarmament in Geneva .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O B-LOC O
" It is a sad fact that the nuclear weapon states show no interest in giving up their nuclear hegemony , " the statement said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Our security concerns oblige us to maintain our nuclear option , " he said , adding that India had exercised restraint in not carrying out any nuclear tests since the country 's lone test blast in 1974 .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He said : " We cannot accept constraints on our option as long as nuclear weapon states continue to rely on their nuclear arsenals for their security " .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

NEW DELHI 1996-08-22|||B-LOC I-LOC O
The Reserve bank of India governor C. Rangarajan said on Thursday that he expected the cash reserve ratio ( CRR ) maintained by banks to be reduced over the medium term .|||O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Two pct India current account deficit viable - RBI .|||O O B-LOC O O O O O B-ORG O
BOMBAY 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
The Reserve Bank of India Governor Chakravarty Rangarajan said on Thursday that a current account deficit of two percent of gross domestic product ( GDP ) was sustainable given the currrent rate of growth .|||O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" The current account deficit of around two percent of GDP is a sustainable level of deficit given the expected real growth rate and the trends in imports and exports , " Rangarajan said in an address to business leaders in New Delhi .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
Rangarajan said a current account deficit of two percent brought about by a 16-17 percent annual growth in exports and a 14-15 percent rise in imports along with an increase in non-debt flows could lead to a reduction in the debt-service ratio to below 20 percent over the next five years .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Mother Teresa devoted to world 's poor .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O
CALCUTTA 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
Mother Teresa , known as the Saint of the Gutters , won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1979 for bringing hope and dignity to millions of poor , unwanted people with her simple message : " The poor must know that we love them . "|||B-PER I-PER O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While the world heaps honours on her and even regards her as a living saint , the nun of Albanian descent maintains she is merely doing God 's work .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O B-PER O O O
The poor do not need our sympathy and pity .|||O O O O O O O O O O
The task Mother Teresa began alone in 1949 in the slums of densely-populated Calcutta , and grew to touch the hearts of people around the world .|||O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The world disagreed , showering more than 80 national and international honours on her including the Bharat Ratna , or Jewel of India , the country 's highest civilian award .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O
A year later , the Vatican announced she was stepping down as Superior of her Missionaries of Charity order .|||O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O
More than 100 delegates flew in from around the world to elect a successor .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She agreed .|||O O O
In 1993 , she fell in Rome and broke three ribs .|||O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O
In August the same year , while in New Delhi to receive yet another award , she developed malaria , complicated by her heart and lung problems .|||O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Last April she fractured her left collar bone .|||O O O O O O O O O
But her increasing frailty , arthritis and failing eyesight has not stopped her travels around the world to mingle with the poor and desperate .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
She attended a government school and was already deeply religious by the time she was 12 .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At the age of 18 she became a Loretto nun , hoping to work at the Order 's Calcutta mission .|||O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O
She was sent to Loretto Abbey in Dublin and from there to India to begin her novitiate and teach geography at a convent school in Calcutta .|||O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
The message was quite clear , " she told one interviewer . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I knew where I belonged . "|||O O O O O O O
The Vatican and the mother superior in Dublin approved and after intensive training as a nurse with American missionaries she opened her first Calcutta slum school in December 1949 .|||O B-LOC O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O
She took the name of Teresa , after France 's Saint Therese of the Child Jesus .|||O O O O O B-PER O O B-LOC O O B-PER O O O B-PER O
In India she was simply called Mother .|||O B-LOC O O O O B-PER O
Mother Teresa set up her first home for the dying in a Hindu rest house in Calcutta after she saw a penniless woman turned away by a city hospital .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Catholics around the world rose to her defence .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Bernard Hickey|||B-PER I-PER
SYDNEY 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
Media baron Rupert Murdoch 's News Corp Ltd reported lower than expected 1995/96 profits on Thursday , but forecast that the hit film " Independence Day " would help increase profits by at least 20 percent in 1996/97 .|||O O B-PER I-PER O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It said moderating paper prices and solid orders for advertising at its Fox Broadcasting television network in the United States would also help boost profits in the 1996/97 year . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
The bullish comments for the coming year soothed analysts and most shareholders , who were disappointed by the lower than expected profit for 1995/96 .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
News announced pre-abnormals net profit for the year fell six percent to A$ 1.26 billion ( US$ 995 million ) and earnings per share dropped to 40 cents from 46 cents .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Analysts had on average expected a pre-abnormals profit of A$ 1.343 billion .|||O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O
" The year just gone was disappointing , but the outlook for the current year looks good , " First Pacific media analyst Lachlan Drummond said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-PER I-PER O O
News Corp said strong performances in U.S. television and British newspapers were offset by lower profits from News Corp 's magazine and publishing divisions and further hefty losses from its Asian Star TV operations .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O B-LOC O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O
Higher newsprint prices hit profits hard . "|||O O O O O O O O
News Corp said British newspaper operating profits rose 10 percent for the year , as higher cover prices at The Sun and The Times and higher advertising volumes offset increased newsprint costs .|||B-ORG I-ORG O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O
Analysts said sharply lower earnings from News Corp 's book publishing division and its U.S. magazines had been the major surprises in the results for 1995/96 .|||O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O
News Corp said revenue gains at its magazines and inserts division were offset by higher paper prices and lower sales at the U.S. TV Guide .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC B-ORG I-ORG O
News said dramatically lower earnings from the British arm of its Harper-Collins publishing division more than offset healthy results from its U.S. operation .|||B-ORG O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O
But it was the bullish profit forecast for 1996/97 that took the spotlight in the market , with some analysts saying 20 percent may even be an understatement .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" If they 're saying at least 20 percent , then their internal forecasts are probably saying 25 or 30 percent , " said one Sydney media analyst who declined to be named .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O
News Corp 's shares were down eight cents at A$ 6.39 at 2.00 p.m. ( 0400 GMT ) in a soft market .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O

RTRS - Budget cuts to boost Australia savings - RBA .|||B-ORG O O O O O B-LOC O O B-ORG O
CANBERRA 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
The Australian government 's plans to slash its budget deficit should make a useful contribution to national savings , the Reserve Bank of Australia ( RBA ) said in its annual report .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O O
" The government 's announced plans to balance the budget , if realised , would make a useful contribution to raising national savings , " the RBA said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O
The bank said there were concerns fiscal consolidation would unduly restrict growth , but evidence was ambiguous .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In its 1996/97 budget announced on Tuesday , the Australian Coalition government announced an underlying budget deficit of A$ 5.65 billion , and pledged to return the underlying budget balance to surplus by 1998/99 .|||O O O O O O O O O B-MISC B-ORG O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The budget deficit was A$ 10.3 billion in 1995/96 .|||O O O O B-MISC O O O O O
-- Sydney Newsroom 61-2 9373-1800|||O B-ORG I-ORG O O
" Determined and credible efforts to rein in unsustainable fiscal positions ( are ) often rewarded by rising confidence , giving favourable effects on economic activity even in the short term , " it said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" More generally , the long-term effects of fiscal consolidation are clearly positive , with higher saving tending to promote economic growth by raising investment and lowering long-term real interest rates , " the RBA said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O

Malaysia bans nitrofuran usage in chicken feed .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O
Malaysia has banned the use of nitrofuran , an antibiotic , in chicken feed and veterinary applications because it believes the drug could cause cancer , the health ministry said on Thursday .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" It is hoped that livestock breeders and feedmillers will abide by the laws and respect the cabinet decision in the interest of consumer safety , " Health Minister Chua Jui Meng was quoted as saying by the national Bernama news agency .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O
Chua said offenders could face a two-year prison sentence and a maximum fine of 5,000 ringgit ( $ 2000 ) .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Ukraine hails peace as marks five-year independence .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O
Rostislav Khotin|||B-PER I-PER
Ukraine 's declaration of independence in 1991 , backed nine-to-one by a referendum in December of that year , effectively dealt a death blow to the Soviet empire and ended more than three centuries of rule from Moscow .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
" Ukraine 's biggest achievements for five years are the preservation of civil peace and inter-ethnic harmony , " President Leonid Kuchma said in televised statement this week .|||O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O
" Unlike many other post-Soviet countries we were able to deal with conflict situations in a peaceful and civilised way . "|||O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But independence was initially accompanied by hyper-inflation and economic collapse , although there are signs of a turnaround .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Inflation -- a hyper-inflationary 10,300 percent a year in 1993 -- was a respectable 0.1 percent a month in June and July and the economy has just begun to grow .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The national bank and the government have every reason to be proud of their efforts . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Central bank officials said on Thursday that a much-postponed hryvna currency would " definitely " be introduced before the end of this year .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It will replace the interim karbovanets currency , which was introduced at par to the Russian rouble in 1992 but now trades at almost 33 karbovanets per rouble .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ukraine has repeatedly promised to introduce the hryvna but had to postpone the plans because of economic problems .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Proud of its record in promptly joining both the Council of Europe and NATO 's Partnership for Peace , Ukraine caused a foreign policy wrangle this week , offending China by allowing a Taiwanese minister to appear on a public , if unofficial visit .|||O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O
China cancelled a visit by a top-level delegation in protest .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O
But Ukraine , seeing itself as a bridge between Russia and the rapidly Westernising countries of eastern Europe , is looking West as well as East .|||O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-MISC O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O
" But Ukraine cannot be economically oriented on Russia , even though those in some circles push us to do that . "|||O O B-LOC O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Kuchma has said Kiev wants membership of the European Union , associate membership of the Western European Union defence grouping and to move closer to NATO .|||B-PER O O B-LOC O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O B-ORG O
A message from the West this week from U.S. President Bill Clinton congratulated Ukraine on the anniversary , promising to support market reforms and praising Ukraine as a " stabilising factor " in a united Europe .|||O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Oldest Albania book disappears from Vatican - paper .|||O B-LOC O O O B-LOC O O O
TIRANA 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
A 16th-century document , the earliest complete example of written Albanian , has disappeared from the Vatican archives , an Albanian newspaper said on Friday .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-MISC O O O O O
Gazeta Shqiptare said the " Book of Mass ' , by Gjon Buzuku , dating from 1555 and discovered in 1740 in a religious seminary in Rome , was the first major document published in the Albanian language .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O
Tirana 's national library has three copies of the " Book of Mass ' . "|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O
There is nothing left for us but to be grateful to civilisation for inventing photocopies , " Gazeta Shqiptare said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Russia to clamp down on barter deals .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O
MOSCOW 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
Russian officials , keen to cut capital flight , will adopt tight measures to cut barter deals in foreign trade to a minimum , a customs official said on Friday .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Volkova said last year goods had been exported under many Russian barter deals , with nothing imported in return .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O
She said the cost of such unimported goods was $ 1.10 billion in 1995 .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A few days ago Russian President Boris Yeltsin issued a decree on state regulation of foreign barter deals , and Volkova said this " could substantially improve the situation " .|||O O O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O
In line with the decree , which will come into force on November 1 , all Russian barter traders will be obliged to import goods worth the cost of their exports within 180 days .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" If traders are late , they will have to pay fines worth the cost of their exported goods , " Volkova said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
A few years ago , barter deals accounted for up to 25-30 percent of Russian exports because " thousands ( of ) trade companies which popped up preferred barter in the absence of reliable Russian banks and money transfer systems " , Volkova said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-PER O O
" Now many Russian banks are strong and can make various sorts of money tranfers , while incompetent traders are being ousted by more experienced ones .|||O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But the current share of barter deals in Russian exports is still high , " she said .|||O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O
-- Dmitry Solovyov , Moscow Newsroom , +7095 941 8520|||O B-PER I-PER O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Viacom plans " Mission " sequel - report .|||B-ORG O O B-MISC O O O O O
LOS ANGELES 1996-08-22|||B-LOC I-LOC O
Paramount Pictures is going ahead with a sequel to the Tom Cruise blockbuster , " Mission : Impossible " and hopes to release it in the summer of 1998 , Daily Variety reported in its Friday edition .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O
The big-screen version of the spy TV series has grossed $ 175 million domestically since opening May 22 , and $ 338 million overseas so far .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , many critics complained its plot was incomprehensible .|||O O O O O O O O O O
It said " Mission : Impossible " director Brian De Palma would have first crack at the sequel , though no deals have been made yet .|||O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O B-PER I-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Goldman , whose Oscars were for " Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid " and " All the President 's Men " , earlier this summer criticised some of the season 's blockbusters .|||B-PER O O B-MISC O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
However , he singled out " Mission : Impossible " as an especially entertaining movie , Daily Variety said .|||O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O
CRICKET - CRAWLEY FORCED TO SIT AND WAIT .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O
LONDON 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
England batsman John Crawley was forced to endure a frustrating delay of over three hours before resuming his quest for a maiden test century in the third test against Pakistan on Friday .|||B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O
Heavy overnight rain and morning drizzle ruled out any play before lunch on the second day but an improvement in the weather prompted the umpires to announce a 1415 local time ( 1315 GMT ) start in the event of no further rain .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O
Crawley , unbeaten on 94 overnight in an England total of 278 for six , was spotted strumming a guitar in the dressing-room as the Oval ground staff took centre stage .|||B-PER O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O
When brighter weather finally arrived , the umpires announced a revised figure of 67 overs to be bowled with play extended to at least 1900 local time ( 1800 GMT ) .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O

SOCCER - SPONSORS CASH IN ON RAVANELLI 'S SHIRT DANCE .|||O O O O O O B-PER O O O O
Middlesbrough 's Italian striker Fabrizio Ravanelli is to wear his team sponsor 's name on the inside of his shirt so it can be seen when he scores .|||B-ORG O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Every time he finds the net , the grey-haired forward pulls his shirtfront over his head as he runs to salute the fans , and Middlesbrough 's sponsors want to cash in on the spectacle .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O
" Having seen Ravanelli celebrate his goals ...|||O O O B-PER O O O O
" It will give the fans something else to look at besides his chest . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Ravanelli aggravated a foot injury in the 1-0 defeat at Chelsea on Wednesday and was given only an even chance of playing at Nottingham Forest on Saturday by his manager Bryan Robson .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O B-PER I-PER O
-DOCSTART-|||O
TENNIS - AUSTRALIANS ADVANCE AT CANADIAN OPEN .|||O O B-MISC O O B-MISC I-MISC O
TORONTO 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
Unseeded Patrick Rafter recorded the most noteworthy result as he upset sixth-seeded American MaliVai Washington 6-2 6-1 in just 50 minutes .|||O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O
Third-seeded Wayne Ferreira of South Africa defeated Tim Henman of Britain 6-4 6-4 after a three-hour evening rain delay and fifth-seeded Thomas Enqvist of Sweden won his third-round match , eliminating Petr Korda of the Czech Republic 6-3 6-4 .|||O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC I-LOC O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O
Ferreira and Enqvist play in a Friday night quarter-final .|||B-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O
Two Americans , seventh seed Todd Martin and unseeded Alex O'Brien , will meet on Friday after winning matches on Thursday .|||O B-MISC O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
Martin overcame Cedric Pioline of France 2-6 6-2 6-4 and O'Brien beat Mikael Tillstrom of Sweden 6-3 2-6 6-3 .|||B-PER O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O B-PER O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O
Put those two things together and you get a loss . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Before when I was on tour , I always felt I had to be in bed by 9:30 or 10 o'clock and I had to be up at a certain time , " Rafter said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
I just do n't have as many set routines and it 's made me a happier person . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Martin was pleased with his victory over Pioline , his first in five meetings with the 11th-ranked Frenchman . "|||B-PER O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O
It 's always difficult to win a match when you lose the first set , especially against someone you have never beaten , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" I got more aggressive in the second and third sets and the wind picked up and that also affected things because Cedric definitely went off a little bit . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O
The 26-year-old O'Brien , who won the ATP Tour stop in New Haven last week , has now won 18 of his last 20 matches , dating back to qualifying rounds in Los Angeles in late July .|||O O B-PER O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O
He ranks 76th after being 285th four weeks ago .|||O O O O O O O O O O
But I 'm still competing well . "|||O O O O O O O O
Still marvelling at an exciting 64-stroke rally he won in the last game of his second-round match against Javier Sanchez of Spain on Tuesday , Enqvist joked , " Today against Petr there were about 64 strokes in the whole match .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O B-PER O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O
It was mostly short points . "|||O O O O O O O

BASEBALL - SORRENTO HITS SLAM AS SEATTLE ROUTS ORIOLES .|||O O B-PER O O O B-ORG O B-ORG O
BALTIMORE 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
Former Oriole Jamie Moyer allowed two hits over eight scoreless innings before tiring in the ninth and Paul Sorrento added his third grand slam of the season as the Seattle Mariners routed Baltimore 10-3 Thursday .|||O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O
Moyer ( 10-2 ) , who was tagged for a pair of homers by Mike Devereaux and Brady Anderson and three runs in the ninth , walked none and struck out two .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Norm Charlton retired the final three batters to seal the victory .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O
With one out in the fifth Ken Griffey Jr and Edgar Martinez stroked back-to-back singles off Orioles starter Rocky Coppinger ( 7-5 ) and Jay Buhner walked .|||O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-PER I-PER O O
Sorrento followed by hitting a 1-2 pitch just over the right-field wall for a 7-0 advantage .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Things fell in for us , " said Sorrento , who has six career grand slams and hit the ninth of the season for the Mariners .|||O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O
We 've got to make up some ground . "|||O O O O O O O O O O
In the American League wild-card race , the Mariners are three games behind the White Sox , two behind Baltimore and two ahead of the Red Sox heading into Boston for a weekend series .|||O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O B-ORG O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-ORG O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-LOC O O O O O
Moyer retired 11 straight batters between the third and seventh innings and threw two or fewer pitches to 11 of the 29 batters he faced .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" I made some bad pitches at the end but I 'm not going to dwell on it .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We won the game , " said Moyer .|||O O O O O O O B-PER O
Coppinger ( 7-5 ) was tagged for eight runs and 10 hits in 4 1/3 innings .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Orioles manager Davey Johnson missed the game after being admitted to a hospital with an irregular heartbeat .|||B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Boston has won 15 of its last 19 games .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O
Boston 's Roger Clemens ( 7-11 ) was one out away from his second straight shutout when pinch-hitter Matt Stairs tripled over the head of centre fielder Lee Tinsley on an 0-2 pitch and pinch-hitter Terry Steinbach dunked a broken-bat single into right to lift Oakland into a 1-1 tie .|||B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O
The run broke Clemens ' 28-inning shutout streak , longest in the majors this season .|||O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Angels battered Kenny Rogers ( 10-7 ) for five runs in the first .|||O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O
The Yankees have allowed at least two runs in the first inning in six straight games , getting outscored 21-1 in the first inning in that span .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chuck Finley ( 12-12 ) snapped a four-game losing streak .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O
In Kansas City , Travis Fryman doubled in the go-ahead run in the fifth and Melvin Nieves and Damion Easley belted two-run homers as the Detroit Tigers claimed a 10-3 win over the Royals , handing them their fifth straight loss .|||O B-LOC I-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O
The Tigers won their third straight and halted a seven-game road losing streak behind Justin Thompson ( 1-2 ) , who earned his first major-league win .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
Tim Belcher ( 12-8 ) was tagged for six runs and nine hits in eight innings .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At Minnesota , Ken Hill allowed two runs en route to his sixth complete game of the season and Rusty Greer added three hits , including a homer , and two RBI as the red-hot Texas Rangers routed the Twins 11-2 .|||O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG O O
The Rangers , who won for the 11th time in their last 13 games , have scored 45 runs in their last five contests .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

-DOCSTART-|||O
Adrian Warner|||B-PER I-PER
BRUSSELS 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
Russia 's double Olympic champion Svetlana Masterkova smashed her second world record in just 10 days on Friday when she bettered the mark for the women 's 1,000 metres .|||B-LOC O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
After breaking the world record for the women 's mile in Zurich last Wednesday , the Olympic 800 and 1,500 metres champion clocked two minutes 28.98 seconds over 1,000 at the Brussels grand prix meeting .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O
The Russian ate up the ground in a swift last lap to shave 0.36 seconds off the previous best of 2:29.34 set by Mozambique 's Maria Mutola in the same stadium in August last year .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O
Former world 800 champion Mutola pushed Masterkova all the way , finishing second in 2:29.66 .|||O O O O B-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O O O
But it was the Russian who picked up the bonus of $ 25,000 for the historic run in front of a capacity 40,000 crowd .|||O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The record of four minutes , 12.56 seconds in Zurich earned Masterkova a bonus of $ 50,000 plus one kilo of gold .|||O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
After Friday 's performance the Russian will have earned well over $ 100,000 in less than a fortnight , taking her appearance money into account .|||O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Brussels organisers had laid a new track for the meeting comparable to the surface at the Atlanta Games but put down on a softer surface .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O
Masterkova clearly enjoyed it .|||B-PER O O O O
Mutola looked threatening in the final 200 metres but the Russian found an extra gear to power home several strides ahead , pointing at the time on the clock with delight as she crossed the line .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BRUSSELS 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O

ATHLETICS - MITCHELL UPSTAGES TRIO OF OLYMPIC SPRINT CHAMPIONS .|||O O B-PER O O O B-MISC O O O
BRUSSELS 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
American Dennis Mitchell upstaged a trio of past and present Olympic 100 metres champions on Friday with a storming victory at the Brussels grand prix .|||B-MISC B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O
Sporting his customary bright green outfit , the U.S. champion clocked 10.03 seconds despite damp conditions to take the scalp of Canada 's reigning Olympic champion Donovan Bailey , 1992 champion Linford Christie of Britain and American 1984 and 1988 champion Carl Lewis .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O B-MISC O O O O B-PER I-PER O
Mitchell also beat world and Olympic champion Bailey at the most lucrative meeting in the sport in Zurich last week .|||B-PER O O O O B-MISC O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O
The American , who finished fourth at the Atlanta Games , was fast out of his blocks and held off Bailey 's late burst in the final 20 metres before heading off for a lap of celebration .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Canadian was second in 10.09 with Lewis third in 10.10 , ahead of Atlanta bronze medallist Ato Boldon who clocked 10.12 in fourth .|||O B-MISC O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O
Christie , competing in what is expected to be his last major international meeting , finished fifth in 10.14 .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lewis , making a rare appearance in Europe in a sprint race , left the track with a slight limp .|||B-PER O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
American Olympic high hurdles champion Allen Johnson defied the wet conditions to produce a brilliant 12.92 seconds in the 110 metres race , just 0.01 outside the world record held by Britain 's Colin Jackson .|||B-MISC I-MISC O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O
Johnson ran the same time at the U.S. Olympic trials in Atlanta in June to become the second equal fastest hurdler of all time with American Roger Kingdom .|||B-PER O O O O O O B-LOC B-MISC O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O
He seemed to relish the new track at the Brussels meeting , dominating the race from start to finish with a slight wind at his back .|||O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The rain was pelting down when the women 's high hurdlers stepped up for their 100 metres race .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Olympic silver medallist Brigita Bukovec of Slovenia could finish only fifth in the race in 12.95 .|||B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O
Jamaican Commonwealth champion Michelle Freeman took second in 12.77 ahead of Cuban Aliuska Lopez .|||B-MISC B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O
Jamaican veteran Merlene Ottey , who beat Devers in Zurich after just missing out on the gold medal in Atlanta after a photo finish , had to settle for third place in 11.04 .|||B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O B-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
American world champion Gwen Torrence , the bronze medallist in Atlanta , was second in 11.00 .|||B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O
It was a costly defeat for Ottey since it threw her out of the race for the Golden Four jackpot .|||O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O

Nigerian terms jeopardize Commonwealth trip-Canada .|||B-MISC O O B-ORG B-MISC O
Commonwealth ministers concerned about human rights in Nigeria may cancel a planned trip there because of government restrictions on their mission , Canadian Foreign Minister Lloyd Axworthy said on Friday .|||B-ORG O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O O O O
" The reaction of the regime there is such that many of us feel that the mission under the present circumstances should n't go ahead , " Axworthy said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
Commonwealth foreign ministers will meet in London on Wednesday to discuss what to do , he added .|||B-ORG O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
Investors gave into gold fever Friday morning , with heavy trading in a handful of Toronto-based gold companies .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O
TVX Gold Inc was up C$ 0.30 to C$ 11.55 in trading of 780,000 shares , while Kinross Gold Corp gained C$ 0.25 to C$ 11 in volume of 720,000 shares .|||B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O B-MISC O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-MISC O O B-MISC O O O O O O O
And Scorpion Minerals Inc , a junior gold exploration company with five Indonesian mining properties , was up C$ 0.50 to C$ 6 , with about 120,000 shares changing hands .|||O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O B-MISC O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O
But Scorpion was raising a lot of eyebrows after it issued a release Friday morning saying it was not aware of any developments that could have affected the stock .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The company was formed this year and a couple of analysts have been on their properties , said one analyst .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Exploration results are expected soon .|||O O O O O O

Colombia , U.S. reach aviation agreement .|||B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O
The U.S. and Colombian governments reached an agreement that will allow AMR Corp 's American Airlines to operate three round-trip flights between New York and Bogota , the Department of Transportation said Friday .|||O B-LOC O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O
The United States also will be able to designate one new all-cargo carrier for service between the two nations after two years .|||O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Colombia was permitted to add a single additional round-trip flight to its current New York service , although it will not be able to do so while under Category Two ( Conditional ) status under the Federal Aviation Administration 's International Aviation Safety program .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O
Colombia would be allowed to add new service when its safety assessment has been improved , the department said .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The agreement resolved a dispute that arose in June when Colombia turned down American 's request to operate flights between New York and Bogota , a denial that prompted the United States to charge that the Colombians were breaking a bilateral aviation agreement and to propose sanctions against one of two Colombian airlines , Avianca and ACES .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-ORG O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-ORG O B-ORG O

SYDNEY 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
World number one golfer Greg Norman has sacked his coach Butch Harmon after a disappointing season .|||O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O
" Butch and I are finished , " Norman told reporters on Thursday before the start of the World Series of Golf in Akron , Ohio .|||O B-PER O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O B-LOC O B-LOC O
Norman , a two-time British Open champion , parted ways with his long-time mentor after drawing a blank in this year 's four majors , winning two tournaments worldwide .|||B-PER O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The blonde Australian opened with a level par round of 70 in Akron , leaving him four shots adrift of the leaders , Americans Billy Mayfair and Paul Goydos and Japan 's Hidemichi Tanaki .|||O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O
On Wednesday Norman described this year as his worst on the professional circuit since 1991 , when he failed to win a tournament .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" My application this year has been strange , " Norman said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
Maybe I have n't been as keyed up as I should have been . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Sometimes you do n't have it in your head to play .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Maybe this was one of those years where I was there , but I was n't 100 percent there , and you have to be 100 percent to perform , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
