TAIBE , Israel 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
For the first time in Israeli history , an Arab team will take the field when the National League soccer season starts on Saturday .|||O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O
Hapoel Taibe fields four Jewish players and two foreign imports -- a Pole and a Romanian .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-MISC O
The rest of the side is made up mainly of Moslem Arabs .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O
The club , founded in 1961 , has a loyal following in Taibe , an Arab town of 28,000 in the heart of Israel .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-LOC O
But away from their home ground , they face unfriendly crowds who taunt the players with racist abuse .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" The very first thing we thought about after we knew we would be promoted was the game against Betar Jerusalem , " said Taibe supporter Karem Haj Yihye .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER I-PER O
Two weeks ago Taibe , coached by Pole Wojtek Lazarek , met Betar , a club closely associated with the right-wing Likud party , for the first time in a Cup match in Jerusalem .|||O O O B-ORG O O O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-LOC O
One Taibe supporter required hospital treatment for cuts and bruises after a stone struck his head as he was driving from the stadium .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But we know that these are only words , nobody has died from hearing them and it only makes us support our team more vehemently . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The dusty town of Taibe lacks the amenities of Jewish communities and many Israeli Arabs have long complained of state discrimination .|||O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-MISC O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O
We will discuss this with the mayor and hopefully a new or refurbished ground will be completed by the start of the new year . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" We do n't have any connection with the Palestinians , they live over there , " he said , pointing to the West Bank seven km ( four miles ) to the east .|||O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O
We are trying to do all we can to run a professional outfit , we are pleased at any support we get , but do not go out looking to represent the whole Arab world . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O

The separatists , who swept into Grozny on August 6 , still control large areas of the centre of town , and Russian soldiers are based at checkpoints on the approach roads .|||O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O
" The ceasefire is being observed , " said woman soldier Svetlana Goncharova , 35 , short dark hair poking out from under a peaked camouflage cap .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A few helicopters flew overhead , firing off flares , but there was no shooting from the air .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The truce , the latest of several , was agreed in talks on Thursday between Russian peacemaker Alexander Lebed and rebel chief-of-staff Aslan Maskhadov .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O B-PER I-PER O
The two also agreed to set up joint patrols in Grozny , but Goncharova said she was sceptical about whether this could work .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O
" We have to try it , but I doubt if this is possible with the separatists , " she said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Two Russian-built hovercrafts , capable of carrying up to 50 tons each , will begin ferrying passengers and cargo up and down the huge river from its mouth at Belem by the end of the year , Brazil 's Amazon Affairs Department said in a statement .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O

OPTIONS - Euro debt vols seen regrouping after fall .|||O O B-MISC O O O O O O O
LONDON 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
Implied volatility of European bond and interest rate options should stabilise around current levels until early next week after falling before and after this week 's German-led cut in interest rates , traders said .|||O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O
" Volatility has come off a lot .|||O O O O O O O O
A trader at a Japanese bank said Euromark volatility now stood at 14.00 for September contract , 16.75 for December , 19.50 for March and 21.25 for June .|||O O O O B-MISC O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This compared with midweek levels , before the welter of interest rate cuts , of 18.50 for September , 20.00 for December , 22.00 for March and 23.5 for June , he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At 1347 GMT , December Euromark futures were trading at 96.78 , two basis points down on the day .|||O O B-MISC O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He said the sell-off in June vols might have been overdone , which could offer value at current levels .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He said caps and floors would be well bid after the round of interest rate cuts due to the fact these rates should stay low at the short end .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The size of the Bundesbank 's repo rate cut , to 3.00 percent from 3.30 percent , took markets by surprise .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Volatility has a bid to it -- longer-dated volatility more than short-dated because the event people were buying for has passed and now perhaps people will sell some short dated vol and buy some long dated vol , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Long dated volatility has been low this year , so it is still at levels which are not historically high .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" It is not a dangerous level to own vol. You are not going to lose a lot and you could make quite a bit . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He said volatility levels should be stable until markets reassess the situation after a long weekend in Britain .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
He said the absence on holiday of many market makers was a main factor behind falls this week in volatility in high-yielding markets such as Italy , Spain and Sweden .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O B-LOC O
" With high-yielding markets Italy will be a lot more vulnerable in September on economic and political fronts , so I would use current the low level of vol to buy options .|||O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" So sell options on Bunds and France to enhance yield and buy options on Italy , " Coughlan said ..|||O O O O O B-MISC O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-PER O O
-- Stephen Nisbet , International Bonds +44 171 542 6320|||O B-PER I-PER O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O

Following the announcement , Zenith 's stock soared $ 5.50 to $ 16.875 on the New York Stock Exchange .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O
The consortium , called Americast , said the contract was part of its strategy to develop and market the next generation in home entertainment .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In addition to Disney , Americast 's partners are phone companies Ameritech Corp. , BellSouth Corp. , GTE Corp. and SBC Communications .|||O O O B-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O
Zenith also said it planned to build a new $ 100 million plant in Woodridge , Ill .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O
, to make picture tubes for 32- and 35-inch screen TV sets .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The company currently buys the tubes from competitors .|||O O O O O O O O O
The new plant , which is dependent on obtaining financing , will create about 280 new jobs , Zenith said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O
The contract calls for production of the set-top boxes over five years .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Luehrs said manufacturing will begin and revenue will start to roll in during the first half of next year .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Zenith will convert its Chihuahua , Mexico , analogue set-top box plant to manufacture the digital boxes .|||B-ORG O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
Luehrs declined to say when the operation was expected to be profitable .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
Americast will provide the boxes to subscribers as part of the service .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O
Its service is being introduced in selected markets across the United States .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
" We 'll build a lot of these devices into television sets , for digital television , " he said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Huge Windows 95 sales fail to meet expectations .|||O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O
Martin Wolk|||B-PER I-PER
SEATTLE 1996-08-22|||B-LOC O
A year after its massively publicized introduction , Microsoft Corp. 's Windows 95 computer operating system has fallen short of the most optimistic expectations for the software giant and the industry .|||O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But the product , delivered eight months late , has fallen short of its sales potential in part because Microsoft delivered a mixed message to business customers , analysts said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O
" It did n't do as well as it could have , " said Rob Enderle , an analyst with Giga Information Group .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O
" People who were expecting major coat-tails were somewhat disappointed , " said Scott Winkler , an analyst with Gartner Group .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O
" It 's not as though it has n't had an impact , " he said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Symantec Corp. , which had been among the most bullish of software companies at the time of the Windows 95 launch , ended up posting disappointing financial results when retail sales of the operating system fell short of its projections .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Many software developers apparently saw their crucial holiday season sales suffer last year because store shelves were jammed with blue-and-white boxes of Windows 95 , resulting in a shortage of space for seasonal products , said Ann Stephens , president of PC Data Inc .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O
Microsoft executives say they are thrilled with the sales figures , and industry analysts estimate that by sometime next year , the installed base of Windows 95 will surpass that of the older version of Windows , now used on about 100 million computers worldwide .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O
But Enderle said the figure could have been even higher if Microsoft had done a better job of handling the huge demand for technical support from customers who were frustrated trying to install the system .|||O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He and other analysts said corporate America adopted a go-slow approach because Microsoft already was promoting the new version of its high-end Windows NT operating system , expected to be available in stores in the next several weeks .|||O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Microsoft sent a lot of signals that NT was going to be the answer , " Winkler said . "|||O B-ORG O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
Many people began to believe that Windows 95 was being downplayed . "|||O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O
But now that Windows NT 4.0 has been launched , Winkler and others believe only a relatively small proportion of corporate users will elect to pay the added software and hardware costs needed to use it instead of Windows 95 .|||O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O
" Windows 95 is going to do great , " he said . "|||O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O

Lynne O'Donnell|||B-PER I-PER
HONG KONG 1996-08-23|||B-LOC I-LOC O
Up to 100,000 tonnes of copper held in Shanghai bonded warehouses , confounding the world market as to its source and ultimate fate , probably belongs to China 's strategic state reserve , industry sources said on Friday .|||O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
Just who owns the copper is a question that has kept traders and industry analysts guessing since the metal was channelled into Shanghai by the China National Nonferrous Metals Import and Export Corp ( CNIEC ) in June and July .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O
It was unclear whether or not the 40,000 tonnes had cleared customs -- which would provide some concrete indication that the strategic reserve , administered directly by the central government 's State Planning Commission , owned the copper .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O
Traders have said the reserve could negotiate concessions on duties -- three percent import tax and 17 percent value-added tax -- that made the copper prohibitively expensive otherwise .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But one source , the head of a Hong Kong trading house , said it made no difference if the copper was customs cleared or not .|||O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" If they spend all this money moving the copper to Yingkou , it will be sitting there for years , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mystery has surrounded the Shanghai stockpile in recent months , with traders unsure not only of who owns it , but of its exact size and what its owner planned to do with it .|||O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Traders in Asia said CNIEC could well have lent it to the market at around US$ 2,700 a tonne , and then paid somewhere between $ 2,200 and $ 2,400 a tonne when it started taking the metal back earlier this year .|||O O B-LOC O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This would have cleared CNIEC a healthy profit , which could then have been used to finance storage and other costs .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Word that CNIEC had offered the copper to European trading houses in a series of secret meetings unnerved an already jittery market .|||O O B-ORG O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Industry analysts Bloomsbury Minerals Economics ( BME ) said on Wednesday the motivation of the owners of the 85,000 tonnes , " whoever they are , is the most important short-term fundamental " in an already tight world market .|||O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
BME repeated in its latest review rumours of involvement by Sumitomo Corp , with CNIEC said to be helping the Japanese trader unload its copper positions after it revealed in June losses of $ 1.8 billion in a decade of unauthorised deals .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Traders in Shanghai said on Thursday they were unaware of movements out of the Shanghai bonded warehouses .|||O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O
They reported more arrivals that were probably spot purchases .|||O O O O O O O O O O
They also expressed concern that the tonnage in bonded warehouses would move onto the domestic market .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

Softbank to procure $ 900 mln via forex by Sept 5 .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O
TOKYO 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
Softbank Corp said on Friday that it would procure $ 900 million through the foreign exchange market by September 5 as part of its acquisition of U.S. firm , Kingston Technology Co .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O
" It is in the contract that we pay ( Kingston ) $ 900 million by September 5 , " he said , adding that Softbank had already started making forward transactions to buy dollars .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O
On August 15 , computer software retailer Softbank said it would buy 80 percent of Kingston , the world 's largest maker of memory boards , for about $ 1.5 billion in the latest in a series of high-profile acquisitions it has made in the United States .|||O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O

Promodes set to sell German assets - paper .|||B-ORG O O O B-MISC O O O O
PARIS 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
German retailer Promodes is in advanced talks about selling its German assets and the retailer 's board might decide as soon as Tuesday to sell the assets to Spar AG , Les Echos newspaper said on Friday .|||B-MISC O B-ORG O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O
It said investment bank Rothschild & Cie was an intermediary in the talks and added that unlisted German retailers Metro , Rewe and Lidl were also still in discussions .|||O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-ORG O B-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O
Promodes has in Germany its Promo hypermarket unit with 36 Continent superstores , which is 1995 generated 4.7 percent of total Promodes sales .|||B-ORG O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O
The French group entered the German market in 1990 , buying|||O B-MISC O O O B-MISC O O O O O
Promodes was not immediately available for comment .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O
-- Paris newsroom +33 1 4221 5452|||O B-LOC O O O O O

PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - August 23 .|||O O O B-LOC O O O O
DUBLIN 1996-08-23|||B-LOC O
Following are highlights of stories in the Irish press on Friday .|||O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
IRISH INDEPENDENT|||B-ORG I-ORG
- Ireland 's biggest mortgage lender Irish Permanent ended weeks of stalemate when it announced it was increasing its mortgage lending rate by a quarter of a percentage point .|||O B-LOC O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- Two investors who claim to be owed nearly one million Irish pounds by fund manager Tony Taylor believe they may have lost their money .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O
- A second Japanese trawler was under arrest on Thursday night as the Irish Navy and Air Corps continued a cat and mouse game with up to 40 vessels off the Irish coast .|||O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O
- The Irish Department of Enterprise and Employment has widened its probe into Taylor Asset Managers to include the investigation of investments of 10 more investors .|||O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O
- Irish exploration company Ivernia and its South African partner Minorco have received planning permission from the local county council for a major lead and zinc mine at Lisheen , County Tipperary .|||O B-MISC O O B-ORG O O B-MISC I-MISC O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC I-LOC O
- Building materials firm CRH refused to comment on reports that it is about to pay 180 million pounds stering for U.S. stone and concrete business Tilcon Inc .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O
IRISH TIMES|||B-ORG I-ORG
- Mortgage lending rates are on the way up with banks and building societies poised to add around a quarter of a percentage point to their main variable rates of interest .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
- Members of a County Antrim Protestant family who were driven into exile by by loyalist paramilitaries two years ago returned yesterday to live in Northern Ireland in defiance of the threat hanging over them .|||O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O
- Talks will resume next Tuesday in an attempt to avoid a major strike in Irish retail chain Dunnes Stores .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-ORG I-ORG O
- Top dealers in the London office of U.S. bankers Merrill Lynch are transferring to Dublin .|||O O O O O B-LOC O O B-LOC O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-LOC O
- The Irish plastics industry called on the government to support incineration to deal with plastics not suitable for recycling .|||O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

SHANGHAI 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
Jiangling Motors Corp , in a statement in Saturday 's edition of the China Securities newspaper , said net profit in the period was 3.385 million yuan , down from 14.956 million in the same 1995 period .|||B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Turnover fell to 937.891 million yuan from 1.215 billion , while net assets per share were 1.88 yuan , unchanged , and earnings per share fell to 0.005 yuan from 0.02 yuan , the statement said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the first half , the company said it produced 8,333 vehicles and sold 9,018 , but it did not explain the difference .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It blamed the drop in profits on a weak vehicle market and said as its engine plant had only just started trial production , the company 's results would not improve in the short-term .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The company , in the southern province of Jiangxi , had about eight percent of China 's light truck market in 1994 .|||O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O
( $ 1 = 8.3 yuan )|||O O O O O O O

RALLYING - KANKKUNEN IN COMMAND AS MCRAE ROLLS OUT .|||O O B-PER O O O B-PER O O O
JYVASKYLA , Finland 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
Finland 's Juha Kankkunen produced an impressive performance in his Toyota on Saturday to open up a 37 seconds lead after six stages of the 1,000 Lakes Rally , sixth round of the world championship .|||B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O
On a weekend overshadowed by Friday 's fatal accident , four times world champion Kankunnen emerged from the first five of Saturday 's 10 stages with a commanding advantage over his country 's latest prospect , Marcus Gronholm , also in a Toyota .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-ORG O
World championship leader Tommi Makinen in his Mitsubishi was third but current world champion Colin McRae ended a bad week by crashing out .|||O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-ORG O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O
After being fined $ 250,000 by the sports governing body on Tuesday , the British driver rolled his Subaru 6.5 km into stage six .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-ORG O O O O O O
He and co-driver Derek Ringer were unhurt but team boss David Richards was furious with them .|||O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O
" It 's not unfortunate , it 's incompetent , " he declared .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Kankkunen has set an astonishing pace for a driver who has not rallied for three months .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" If you do a lot of something , sometimes it 's good to have a break .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It 's not bad for an old man ! "|||O O O O O O O O O O
said the 37-year-old veteran .|||O O O O O
Ford had a poor morning with Spaniard Carlos Sainz losing 90 seconds through turbo trouble while Belgian Bruno Thiry dropped four minutes when a transmission shaft snapped .|||B-ORG O O O O O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O

A Belgian man died and 31 people were injured after an accident in Friday 's opening phase of the world championship 1,000 Lakes Rally .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O
Danish driver Karsten Richardt had ploughed into the crowd during the two-kilometre first stage held in the host city of Jyvaskyla .|||B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
Richardt 's Mitsubishi skidded down an escape road and ploughed into a cordoned-off area for spectators .|||B-PER O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A second Belgian was also seriously injured but the hospital spokesman said his life was not in danger .|||O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The stage was suspended but the four-day rally resumed on Saturday .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
A woman was killed before last year 's event when she walked in front of a car practising on the course .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

CRICKET - ESSEX POISED TO STEP UP TITLE CHALLENGE .|||O O B-ORG O O O O O O O
LONDON 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
Essex are set to step up their English county championship challenge with a fifth consecutive victory after new-ball pair Neil Williams and Mark Ilott sent Gloucestershire reeling on Saturday .|||B-ORG O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O B-ORG O O O O
Williams seized two wickets in two deliveries and left-armer Ilott also captured two as Gloucestershire , 252 behind on first innings , slumped to 27 for four at the close on the third day of the four-day game at Colchester .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
Essex , who started the current round of matches in fifth place 20 points behind leaders Derbyshire with a game in hand , could go top if they complete victory on Monday 's last day and other results favour them .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Williams thrust Essex on course for success by dispatching Matt Windows and Andrew Symonds in his second over , before Ilott removed Dominic Hewson and Tim Hancock to reduce Gloucestershire to 17 for four at one stage .|||B-PER O B-ORG O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O B-PER O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O
The visitors had started the day optimistically by sending back former England captain Graham Gooch when he added just six to his overnight 105 , but Essex went on to make 532 for eight before declaring .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O
Second-placed Kent were frustrated by rain which prevented any play at Cardiff , where they have reached 255 for three in their first innings against Glamorgan , while third-placed Surrey are facing an uphill task against Nottinghamshire .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O B-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG O
Fourth-placed Leicestershire had Hampshire on the ropes at Leicester before rain intervened .|||O B-ORG O B-ORG O O O O B-LOC O O O O
Yorkshire rekindled their title hopes after three successive defeats by taking the upper hand against arch-rivals Lancashire at Old Trafford .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O B-LOC I-LOC O
Facing Yorkshire 's 529 for eight declared , Lancashire were forced to follow on 206 behind after being bowled out for 323 , paceman Darren Gough polishing off the innings with a burst of three wickets for one run in 17 deliveries .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Lancashire then reached 210 for five at the close -- just four ahead -- after Neil Fairbrother hit 55 in 60 balls to add to his first innings of 86 .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

SOCCER - OUT-OF-SORTS NEWCASTLE CRASH 2-1 AT HOME .|||O O O B-ORG O O O O O
LONDON 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
Newcastle 's early season teething problems continued on Saturday when they lost 2-1 at home to premier league pacesetters Sheffield Wednesday .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O
Guy Whittingham stole three points for the Yorkshire side with a goal 10 minutes from time .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O
Elsewhere , title hopefuls Liverpool were held 0-0 at home by newly-promoted Sunderland , and in London , the tie between Tottenham Hotspur and Everton also ended goaless .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O B-LOC O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O

PRETORIA , South Africa 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O B-LOC I-LOC O
New Zealand made history on Saturday when they completed their first series victory in South Africa with a 33-26 victory in the second test .|||B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O
The win gave the All Blacks an unbeatable 2-0 lead in the three-test series .|||O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O
Two tries from wing Jeff Wilson in the first quarter gave New Zealand a 24-11 lead before tries from flanker Ruben Kruger and scrum-half Joost van der Westhuizen in the space of two minutes narrowed the gap to a single point at 23-24 .|||O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Springboks would have gone ahead had not fly-half Joel Stransky 's conversion hit an upright and New Zealand only scrambled to safety through a fine penalty from replacement fly-half Jon Preston and a drop goal by number eight Zinzan Brooke .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O
-DOCSTART-|||O

AMSTERDAM 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
Dutch champions Ajax Amsterdam faltered in their second league match of the season on Saturday losing 2-0 away at Heerenveen .|||B-MISC O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O
Ajax , who had a dismal series of pre-season results before beating NAC of Breda in their opening game , had the best of an entertaining first half but failed to break the deadlock .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Eight minutes after the interval , Heerenveen 's Romeo Wouden broke through the Amsterdam defence , left defender John Veldman standing and curled the ball beyond goalkeeper Edwin van der Sar into the Ajax net .|||O O O O O O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O B-LOC O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER O O B-ORG O O
Ajax , without injured defenders Marcio Santos and Winston Bogarde and strikers Jari Litmanen and Marc Overmars , then stepped up the pace and looked certain to equalise .|||B-ORG O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
But they left gaps at the back and on 73 minutes Danish striker Jon Dahl Tomasson rushed out of his own half , beat the Ajax defence and lobbed van der Sar .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER O
The defeat means Ajax 's main title contenders PSV Eindhoven , who beat the champions 3-0 in the traditional league curtain-raiser , can go three points clear of their rivals if they beat Groningen on Sunday .|||O O O B-ORG O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

British hostage in Chechnya describes ordeal .|||B-MISC O O B-LOC O O O
Michael Penrose , a 23-year-old worker with the group Action Against Hunger , described his ordeal to a news conference when he arrived back in Britain from Moscow .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O
" The worst period of physical manhandling was during that time when we were beaten with Kalashnikovs and at one point I had a Kalashnikov held to the back of my throat -- cocked , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" For the first period we were held in a small room with no bed or anything .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We had very little food and sometimes went two or three days without eating . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" During the last 15 days of being held , the fighting in Grozny was very close .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O
At first it was street fighting outside the house and then we came under very heavy shelling and bombardment from conventional weapons like tanks , artillery and grenade launchers , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Penrose had been working for the charity which provides food to civilians for only a few weeks before he was captured .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

LONDON 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
Diana first met the Albanian-born missionary in Rome in 1992 .|||B-PER O O O B-MISC O O B-LOC O O O
The princess , who has carved out a major role for herself as a helper of the sick and needy , is said to have turned to Mother Teresa for guidance as her marriage crumbled to heir to the British throne Prince Charles .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O

Adventurers start Canadian wilderness race .|||O O B-MISC O O O
About 350 adventurers from nine countries set out on Saturday to climb , raft , bike and run in a 323-mile ( 517-km ) endurance race through the Canadian wilderness .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O
I think it will be more physically challenging and we 'll have to go up against more diverse situations due to the terrain , " said Dr. Michael Stroud , a veteran Eco-Challenge participant .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O B-MISC O O
The 70 teams in this year 's race will will trek glaciers , climb mountains , whitewater raft , horseback ride , canoe and mountain bike along the grueling course .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The area is filled with treacherous mountain peaks , ice fields and frigid waters .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Organisers expect about two-thirds of the participants to drop out or be disqualified before the finish .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The hardy ones are expected to complete the course in about six days , with first-place finishers receiving $ 10,000 in prize money .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In the Eco-Challenge , competitors race in teams of five which must include both men and women .|||O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Team members must remain within 100 yards ( metres ) of each other at all times and finish together .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
LAGOS 1996-05-28|||B-LOC O
An outbreak of cholera has killed 21 people in a week at Ubimini in oil-rich southern Nigeria , the News Agency of Nigeria reported on Saturday .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-LOC O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O
BLANTYRE 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
Malawi 's frail former president , Kamuzu Banda , said on Saturday in a rare public interview that he was feeling well despite his advanced years .|||B-LOC O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" I feel all right and I eat everything that is put on the table .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
And that means I am all right , " he told reporters invited to his home .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He clutched a fly whisk which for a long time symbolised his obsession with power .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Malawi 's undisputed ruler for three decades , he lost power in the first all-party elections in 1994 .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He spent a year under house arrest and was tried but acquitted last year on charges of ordering the murder of four opponents in 1983 .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Zimbabwe fires striking civil servants .|||B-LOC O O O O O
The Zimbabwean government fired thousands of workers on Saturday for defying an order to end a strike which has crippled essential services and disrupted international and domestic flights .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" All civil servants who did not return to work at their normal working hours , and remained working for the full working day on 23 August 1996 , have been summarily dismissed ...|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
with immediate effect , " it said in a statement .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
Public Service , Labour and Social Welfare Minister Florence Chitauro told state radio her ministry had already begun recruiting other people to replace the strikers , sub-contracting some of the work to private firms .|||B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But the strikers ignored the threat and vowed to stay on the streets until their demands for wage rises of 30 to 60 percent were met .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It has also disrupted flights .|||O O O O O O
Some internal services were cancelled , leaving tourists at the Victoria Falls resort stranded , and flights abroad were delayed .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O
The PSA said 80 percent of the country 's 180,000 civil servants took part in the strike which is a rare challenge to President Robert Mugabe , who has been in power since independence from Britain in 1980 .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O
Opposition parties , civic organisations and private-sector unions have expressed support for the action and denounced the government 's pay rises of up to eight percent for its workers .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Civil servants earn on average Z$ 1,000 ( $ 100 ) a month .|||O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O
They say their pay has not kept up at all with inflation , currently running at 22 percent .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Rwanda says Zaire expels 28 Rwandan refugees .|||B-LOC O B-LOC O O B-MISC O O
KIGALI 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
Captain Firmin Gatera , spokesman for the Tutsi-dominated Rwandan army , told Reuters in Kigali that 17 of the 28 refugees handed over on Friday from the Zairean town of Goma had been soldiers in the former Hutu army which fled to Zaire in 1994 after being defeated by Tutsi forces in Rwanda 's civil war .|||O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-MISC B-MISC O O O B-ORG O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-LOC O O O O
Zairean Prime Minister Kengo wa Dondo said on Thursday in a visit to Rwanda that his country would expell all the refugees back to Rwanda but he gave no timeframe .|||B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O
Zaire is home to 1.1 million Rwandan Hutu refugees who fled three months of civil war in 1994 .|||B-LOC O O O O O B-MISC B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O
Many had taken part in the genocide that year of one million people , mostly Tutsis , and refuse to go home for fear of reprisal at the hands of the new Tutsi-dominated government in Kigali .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-LOC O
Gatera said the refugees were handed over following a deal made at a meeting between the governor of Zaire 's north Kivu region and his counterpart in the Rwandan border town of Gisenyi .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-LOC O
" After a meeting between the governor of north Kivu and the prefect of Gisenyi , 28 prisoners ( refugees ) were handed over to Rwandan authorities on Friday , " Gatera said . "|||O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O B-PER O O O
Out of these 17 were former soldiers .|||O O O O O O O O
These people are now in Gisenyi prison , " Gatera added .|||O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-PER O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Revered skull of S. Africa king is Scottish woman 's .|||O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O B-MISC O O O
A limelight-loving South African chief was in disgrace on Saturday after a prized skull he brought home from Scotland was identified as belonging not to his sacred tribal ancestor , but to a middle-aged white woman .|||O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chief Nicholas Gcaleka , dressed in animal skins and full tribal regalia , journeyed to a wintry Scotland in February on a hugely publicised quest to find Hintsa 's skull .|||O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
He said the spirit of a hurricane had guided him there .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
Members of the Xhosa royal family , branding Gcaleka a charlatan , confiscated the head and sent it for tests to a forensic scientist , who examined the shape of the skull and the hole that he determined had not come , as supposed , from a bullet .|||O O O B-MISC O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Laurence McQuillan|||B-PER I-PER
WASHINGTON 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
President Bill Clinton has served notice he intends to be busy " making news " -- or at least doing things that look and sound like it in a campaign year .|||O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Sixty days ago I directed the attorney general to draw up a plan for a national registry of sex offenders , " Clinton said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
That plan has now reached my desk . "|||O O O O O O O O O
" Today I am pleased to announce that we are following through on our commitment to keep track of these criminals , not just in a single state but wherever they go , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Actually , creation of such a registry was underway without Clinton lifting a finger .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O
Now , 60 days later , he had a chance to talk about it again .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is an example of Clinton 's strategic planning as he heads into the stretch drive for the Nov. 5 presidential election .|||O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Such things do not happen by chance in the Clinton White House , they are part of his political chess game .|||O O O O O O O O O B-PER B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O
In the past week Clinton signed into law an increase in the minimium wage , a bill that makes it easier for someone with a pre-existing health problem to change jobs , and sweeping changes overhauling the nation 's welfare system .|||O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" America can look back on a week of remarkable achievement , " Clinton said , without even a passing reference to the Republican majority in the House and Senate .|||O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-ORG O B-ORG O
According to a senior campaign official , Clinton " will be making a lot of news in the coming week -- something different each day . "|||O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" He 'll make news during the day ... and then at night the attention will go to the convention , " said the campaign official . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We think it 'll work really well . "|||O O O O O O O O O
Although officials decline to say just what each day 's " news " will be , the intent is to put a focus on Clinton himself and not just those attending the party 's convention .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
Each day of the trip will have a late start , so that network television correspondents will be able to do live reports for morning programmes .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" We 'll be concentrating ... on supporting the president as he is on the trip and making significant public policy statements related to some of his plans for the future , " said White House Press Secretary Mike McCurry .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O B-PER I-PER O
McCurry said that when Clinton delivers his acceptance address on Thursday night to fellow Democrats and a national television audience , he will " set out a road map " for the nation 's future -- one the president hopes guides him back to the White House for four more years .|||B-PER O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O

Jeremy Lovell|||B-PER I-PER
BRUSSELS 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
Belgian police searched two more houses on Saturday for bodies in a child-sex scandal of murder , kidnapping and pornography that has sent a shockwave of revulsion throughout Europe .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
In just over a week two young girls have been found dead , from starvation , two have been freed from a dungeon-like secret compartment and an international hunt has started for at least two others .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On Saturday investigators with dogs trained to find bodies searched one house at Ransart and one at Mont-sur-Marchienne -- both suburbs of the southern city of Charleroi .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
Both houses are owned by Dutroux .|||O O O O O B-PER O
Belgian media speculated that Dutroux , charged with abduction and illegal imprisonment of children , must have had high level protection to molest youngsters .|||B-MISC O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bourlet said between 300 and 400 paedophile porn video tapes had been seized , some of which featured Dutroux .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O
Dutroux was charged a week ago after police rescued two young girls from a concrete dungeon in the basement of one of the six houses he owns in and around Charleroi .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
Just a day later the national euphoria at the rescue turned to disgust as Dutroux led police to the bodies of two eight-year-old girls in another of his houses .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Julie Lejeune and Melissa Russo , had been kidnapped in June last year .|||B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O
Five other people have been arrested including Dutroux 's second wife Michelle Martin , charged as an accomplice .|||O O O O O O O B-PER O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O
The others have been charged with abduction and illegal imprisonment of children or are suspected of criminal association .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Dutch police are also holding a 74-year old Dutchman in connection with the disappearance of An and Eefje , although a spokesman said no direct link had yet been established .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O B-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At least part of the speculation in the Belgian media of high-level protection for Dutroux and his accomplices is based on leaked documents cataloguing a high degree of police bungling , incompetence and indifference .|||O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among the revelations are the fact that the gendarmerie was running a surveillance operation codenamed " Othello " against Dutroux in 1995 -- when both Julie and Melissa and An and Eefje were kidnapped .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-PER O O O O O B-PER O B-PER O B-PER O B-PER O O O

An estimated 50,000 Algerians and more than 110 foreigners have been killed in violence pitting Moslem rebels against government forces since early 1992 , when the authorities cancelled a general election in which radical Islamists had taken a commanding lead .|||O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O
Police in Malta said on Saturday they had seized 7.5 tonnes of cannabis concealed in a shipment of chilli sauce on its way from Singapore to Romania .|||O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O
Police commissioner George Grech said the cannabis was found on Friday packed in 500 boxes hidden behind chilli sauce in a container that arrived at Malta Freeport a week ago .|||O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O
The container was on its way to Romania via the former Yugoslavia from Singapore and was the biggest drugs haul in Malta , police said .|||O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O

Most Spaniards back talks with Basque rebels--poll .|||O O O O O B-MISC O O
MADRID 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
While 57 percent of the population supported negotiations with ETA ( Basque Homeland and Freedom ) , 30 percent opposed it , the survey by the state-controlled Centre for Sociological Studies ( CIS ) found .|||O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O
But 80 percent said ETA had shown little interest in achieving peace in the Basque country when it offered a one-week truce in July while continuing to hold prison officer Jose Antonio Ortega Lara , kidnapped in January .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER I-PER O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Thirty killed as floods plunge Lahore into chaos .|||O O O O O B-LOC O O O
ISLAMABAD 1996-08-24|||B-LOC O
They said 461 mm ( 18 inches ) of rain had drenched the Punjab provincial capital in 36 hours , turning streets into rivers , knocking out power , water and telephone services , disrupting air and rail traffic , and sweeping away houses and cars .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Newspapers quoted witnesses as saying they had seen bodies floating in the streets .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Among the dead were five members of the religious Jamaat-i-Islami party who drowned while trying to remove books from a basement library .|||O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
They said thousands of people had been made homeless after a breach opened in the city canal , inundating residential areas .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Officials said the Ravi and Chenab rivers , which both flow through Punjab , were in high flood and emergency services backed by troops were on full alert .|||O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Internet Startup funded to develop Java software .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-MISC O O
A small team of engineers from Sun Microsystems Inc. 's JavaSoft unit said Sunday they have formed a new company , dubbed Internet Startup , to build Java infrastructure software .|||O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-MISC O O O
The fledgling company , established in a ground-floor office here over the last two weeks , has received venture financing from Bessemer Venture Partners of Menlo Park , Calif ..|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O
David Cowan , Internet Startup founder and acting chief executive , is a general partner of Bessemer .|||B-PER I-PER O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O
The startup company 's acting chairman is Jim Bidzos , the president of RSA Data Security , a unit of Security Dynamics Technologies Inc. as well as chairman of VeriSign .|||O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-ORG O
Java is a computer programming language introduced by Sun Microsystems in mid-1995 which has immediately captured the attention of the industry for its ability to operate across virtually all computer system in a relatively secure manner .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Just last week , Sun Microsystems and the Silicon Valley venture capital giant Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers said they had completed financing of a $ 100 million fund managed by Kleiner Perkins to fund startups developing Java technologies .|||O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O B-MISC O O
Prasad Wagle , another former senior JavaSoft engineer who is among the founding engineers at Internet Startup , said the new company aims to build software infrastructure using Java to make networked applications ubiquitious .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O
One feature of the Java language is that small software programmes , known as " applets " because they are small applications , can be downloaded from the server computers at the centre of networks onto individual computers for use .|||O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In this model , individual computer users can always gain access to the latest programmes and do not need to store more software than they are currently using on their computers at any one time , also saving costs of memory and storage .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chris Zuleeg , a veteran of Apple and a former JavaSoft marketing manager , is vice president of marketing at Internet Startup , whose Web site is www.internetstartup.com .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O B-ORG O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
GOLF - MICKELSON WINS FOURTH TITLE OF YEAR IN AKRON .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O B-LOC O
AKRON , Ohio 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
Phil Mickelson birdied two of the last three holes to win World Series of Golf by three strokes over Billy Mayfair on Sunday .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O
It was the fourth tournament title this year for Mickelson , who shot an even-par 70 , after being tied for the lead with Billy Mayfair with three holes to play .|||O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O
" It was very hard to sleep last night because there was so much I could accomplish with this win , " said Mickelson , who had a three-stroke lead entering the third round . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
The $ 378,000 first place check brings Mickelson back to the top of the money list with $ 1,574,799 won this year .|||O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" This is a major championship golf course , and for me to perform well on this style of course is a big step up for me in my career and my performance in future majors , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
On the back nine Mickelson began driving erratically , and poor tee shots resulted in bogeys on the , eighth , 12th and 13th holes , bringing Mickelson back to four under par , tied with Mayfair , who had parred 14 straight holes after the birdie on no.2 .|||O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mickelson then set up a tap in birdie on the 16th , sending a wedge shot to 18 inches .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He had another birdie on the 17th , where he his a 6-iron to six feet .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mayfair bogeyed the 17th , missing a five foot par putt , and dropped from solo second place to a three way tie for second .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It was the second successive year in which Mayfair has finished runner up in this tournament .|||O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O
He lost to Greg Norman in sudden death last year .|||O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O
The defending champion was in contention , two behind Mickelson for much of the day , until he bogeyed the 13th and 14th holes .|||O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

MOTORCYCLING - JAPANESE WIN BOTH ROUND NINE SUPERBIKE RACES .|||O O B-MISC O O O B-PER O O O
SUGO , Japan 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
Teenager Yuuichi Takeda , racing in only his first season , outclassed the big names to win the first race in round nine of the world superbike championship on Sunday .|||O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Takeda , 18 , showed poise far beyond his years to overtake Australian Ducati rider Troy Corser , last year 's championship runner-up , with four of the 25 laps left .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Honda 's Takeda was pursued past Corser by the Yamaha duo of Noriyuki Haga and Wataru Yoshikawa with Haga briefly taking the lead in the final chicane on the last lap .|||B-ORG O B-PER O O O B-PER O O B-ORG O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But Takeda found one more spurt of power to just take the flag first with Haga second and Yoshikawa third .|||O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O B-PER O O
Haga had the consolation of recording the fastest lap at 147.159 kph .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
Corser , who crashed during practice on Friday , limped in fourth , four seconds behind Takeda with championship leader Aaron Slight of New Zealand 11 seconds behind the winner .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O
Aoki , the elder brother of reigning 125cc world champion Haruchika , had a race-long duel with John Kocinski of the United States on a Ducati before taking the chequered flag .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-LOC I-LOC O O B-ORG O O O O O O
With Takeda out of the race , Kocinski regained second place but he could not overtake Aoki .|||O B-PER O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER O
Haga again was the unlucky rider finishing third ahead of Slight with Corser in 10th place .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER O B-PER O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

Pollock , who returns home on Tuesday for an ankle operation , took the last three wickets in nine balls as Worcestershire were dismissed for 154 .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O
Warwickshire are currently in fourth position behind Yorkshire , Nottinghamshire and Surrey .|||B-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG O B-ORG O B-ORG O

Lancashire 's total of 205 for eight from 40 overs looked reasonable before Byas put their attack to the sword , collecting his runs from just 100 balls with three sixes and nine fours .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Yorkshire eventually reached their target with only four wickets down and 7.5 overs to spare .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

CRICKET - RUN-OUT GIVES LEWIS AND ENGLAND SLIM SATISFACTION .|||O O O O B-PER O B-LOC O O O
LONDON 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O
Chris Lewis did his best to forget his controversial omission from the England one-day squad on Sunday but could not prevent Pakistan reasserting their dominance in the final test at The Oval .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
A super piece of fielding by Lewis , dropped as a disciplinary measure after arriving only 35 minutes before the start on the fourth morning , provided the only bright spot for England as the touring team batted on to reach 413 for five at the interval , a lead of 87 .|||O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There seemed scant danger until the Surrey player swooped on to the ball and returned off balance to county team mate Alec Stewart who whipped off the bails .|||O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O
Lewis , though , could not make similar waves with the ball as Salim Malik and Wasim Akram batted through the rest of the session with few alarms .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
Rain arrived just as the players left the field for lunch , forcing the ground-staff into action yet again .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The weather delayed the resumption for over an hour , the umpires finally announcing play would start again at 1445 local time ( 1345 GMT ) .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

BASEBALL - ORIOLES SNEAK PAST ANGELS .|||O O B-ORG O O B-ORG O
BALTIMORE 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O
Rafael Palmeiro 's two-out single in the sixth inning scored Roberto Alomar with the go-ahead run as the Baltimore Orioles rallied past the California Angels 5-4 and took over the American League 's wild-card berth on Saturday .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O
The Orioles trailed 4-3 when pinch-hitter Mike Devereaux led off the sixth with a triple against reliever Kyle Abbott ( 0-1 ) and scored the tying run on Alomar 's single .|||O B-ORG O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
After Brady Anderson sacrificed , Palmeiro hit the first pitch into right field for a single , scoring Alomar .|||O B-PER I-PER O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O
I was just trying to put the ball in play .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
In Cleveland , Kevin Seitzer 's two-out single in the top of the 10th brought home David Hulse with the winning run as the Milwaukee Brewers sent the Cleveland Indians to their third straight extra-inning defeat 4-3 .|||O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O
Bob Wickman ( 5-1 ) , acquired from the New York Yankees on Friday , earned the win in his Milwaukee debut despite allowing the tying run in the eighth inning .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O
" Yeah , you know it 's fun , it 's always fun when you 've got a chance to go to the ballpark and win a game that 's important , " said Rodriguez . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
Whitehurst , promoted from Triple-A Columbus on Wednesday , allowed seven hits and struck out one without a walk .|||B-PER O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It was his first win since defeating the St. Louis Cardinals on May 28th , 1994 when he was with the San Diego Padres .|||O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O
In Kansas City , Jose Rosado came within one out of his third complete game and Michael Tucker homered and drove in three runs as the Kansas City Royals broke a six-game losing streak with a 9-2 victory over the Detroit Tigers in a battle of cellar-dwellers .|||O B-LOC I-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O
In his last four starts , the 21-year-old left-hander has given up only four earned runs in 29-2/3 innings .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

BASEBALL - BRAVES RALLY TO BEAT CUBS .|||O O B-ORG O O O B-ORG O
ATLANTA 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O
Fred McGriff went 5-for-5 and homered twice , including a three-run blast with two out in the bottom of the ninth inning that lifted the Atlanta Braves to a 6-5 victory over the Chicago Cubs on Saturday .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O
" I was just trying to hang in there and hit it up the middle , " said McGriff about his homer in the ninth . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O
I was just looking for the ball , trying to stay on it .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Brad Clontz ( 6-2 ) picked up the win in relief for Atlanta , which has won 11 of its last 13 games .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
Vinny Castilla and Dante Bichette each added two RBI for Colorado , which improved the major league 's best home mark to 44-20 .|||B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O B-MISC O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At Florida , Kevin Brown scattered seven hits over eight innings and Kurt Abbott snapped a sixth-inning tie with a two-run double as the Florida Marlins defeated the tired Cincinnati Reds 5-3 .|||O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O
The Marlins won for just the third time in nine games , taking advantage of a Reds ' team that has not had a day off since August 8th and was playing its fourth game in 43 hours .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Los Angeles , Tom Candiotti allowed two runs in seven innings and singled home the go-ahead run and Mike Piazza and Todd Hollandsworth drove in two runs apiece as the Los Angeles Dodgers defeated the New York Mets 7-5 .|||O B-LOC I-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O
Candiotti ( 8-9 ) walked one , allowed five hits and struck out a season-high eight batters for Los Angeles , which has won 10 of its last 14 games .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
In San Diego , Joey Hamilton allowed two hits over seven innings and Rickey Henderson hit his major league-record 69th leadoff homer as the San Diego Padres defeated the Philadelphia Phillies 7-1 for their fifth win in six games .|||O B-LOC I-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O
Hamilton ( 12-7 ) won his second straight start , allowing just a sixth-inning run and a pair of singles .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In San Francisco , Pedro Martinez allowed two hits in eight innings and David Segui drove in two runs as the Montreal Expos shut out the San Francisco Giants 3-0 for their third straight win .|||O B-LOC I-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O
Martinez ( 11-7 ) , who lasted just 1-1/3 innings in his last start against San Diego five days ago , pitched eight-plus innings , walking four and striking out 10 .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Portuguese champions Porto kicked off the season with a disappointing 2-2 home draw against Setubal and were lucky to squeeze in an equaliser in extra time .|||B-MISC O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O
Porto , who are fighting to take their third consecutive title this season , were 2-0 down until the 86th minute when a header by Mario Jardel found the net after a string of missed opportunities , including a penalty taken by top league scorer Domingos Oliveira in the 60th minute .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O
Domingos redeemed himself by netting the equaliser just into extra time .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
Benfica , also playing their first game of the season at home , were held to a 1-1 draw by northern side Braga despite the fact that the visitors were reduced to 10 men in the 54th minute after Rodrigo Carneiro was sent off for a second bookable offence .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O
Benfica finally opened the scoring in the 81st minute with a penalty taken by Helder after Luis Baltasar tripped up captain Joao Pinto under the referee 's nose .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O
Braga defender Idalecio gave his team their equaliser seven minutes from the final whistle with a header into the back of the net .|||B-ORG O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

SOCCER - FIORENTINA WIN WITH BATISTUTA DOUBLE .|||O O B-ORG O O B-PER O O
The victory , coming on the eve of the founding of the Florence club in 1926 , also marked the first time since the pre-season trophy between the Cup winners and league champions was started in 1988 that the Cup winners had won .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O
Batistuta gave Fiorentina the lead in the 11th minute .|||B-PER O B-ORG O O O O O O O
Montenegrin midfielder Dejan Savicevic equalised for the home team , weaving past a defender , checking and firing in a left-footed shot in the 21st minute that gave young Fiorentina goalkeeper Francesco Toldo little chance .|||B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O
The scored stayed level to the final minutes but with a penalty shoot out looming , Batistuta took charge .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
The 83rd minute shot , curling over the defence and dipping in under the bar from the striker dubbed Batigol by adoring Fiorentina fans , was just reward for Fiorentina who looked a far more impressive team .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O B-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O
Milan 's player of the year George Weah missed a good first half opportunity but otherwise looked a little rusty while Italian team mate Roberto Baggio did not play due to injury .|||B-ORG O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O
New Dutch signing Edgar Davids came on late in the second half as a Milan substitute but made little impact .|||O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O
The league season starts on September 8 .|||O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

CYCLING - FERRIGATO SPRINTS TO SECOND STRAIGHT WORLD CUP WIN .|||O O B-PER O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O
ZURICH 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O
Andrea Ferrigato of Italy sprinted to his second cycling World Cup win in successive weekends with victory in the Swiss Grand Prix on Sunday .|||B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O B-MISC B-MISC I-MISC O O O
Ferrigato , winner of the Leeds Classic last Sunday with a one second win over Britain 's Max Sciandri , posted a similarly narrow margin of victory again .|||B-PER O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O
All three clocked the same time of five hours 51 minutes , 52 seconds .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Former world champion Lance Armstrong of the United States was in front as the leading pack of seven riders turned into the Oerlikon velodrome for the final one lap sprint but quickly faded and settled for fourth .|||O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

SOCCER - PSV BEAT GRONINGEN 4-1 TO PULL AWAY FROM AJAX .|||O O B-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O B-ORG O
AMSTERDAM 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O
Belgian international Luc Nilis scored twice on Sunday as PSV Eindhoven came from behind to beat Groningen 4-1 in Eindhoven .|||B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-ORG O O B-LOC O
Defending champions Ajax Amsterdam were defeated 2-0 loss away to Heerenveen on Saturday .|||O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG O O O
Groningen took the lead in the seventh minute when Dean Gorre intercepted a back pass from Ernest Faber to goalkeeper Ronald Waterreus and shot home .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-PER I-PER O O O O
Faber made amends in the 32nd minute when he headed in a corner to score the equaliser .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
PSV took control in the second half but could not score until Groningen striker Romano Sion was sent off in the 58th minute .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O
Five minutes after his dimissal , Nilis gave PSV the lead and in the final 15 minutes he added another as did Zeljko Petrovic .|||O O O O O O B-PER O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O
Gaston Taument scored twice and newly signed Argentine Pablo Sanchez once in Feyenoord Rotterdam 's 3-0 victory over Volendam .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O B-ORG O

DUTCH CAPTAIN BLIND ENDS INTERNATIONAL CAREER .|||B-MISC O B-PER O O O O
Endt told Dutch news agency ANP that Blind , 35 , would no longer be available for selection for the national squad .|||B-PER O B-MISC O O B-ORG O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Ajax defender , who led the Netherlands into the quarter-finals at June 's European championship finals in England , had decided to devote his attention to playing for his Amsterdam club , Endt said .|||O B-ORG O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-PER O O
Blind , who played in the 1990 World Cup and the 1992 European championship , was capped 42 times for the Netherlands .|||B-PER O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O B-LOC O
CRICKET - INDIA BANS SIDHU FOR 50 DAYS .|||O O B-LOC O B-PER O O O O
NEW DELHI 1996-08-25|||B-LOC I-LOC O
Indian opener Navjot Singh Sidhu was on Sunday given a 50-day ban from international cricket for quitting this year 's tour of England , the Press Trust of India said .|||B-MISC O B-PER I-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O
The right-handed batsman will have to forfeit half the money he was due to earn from the tour , the news agency said after a disciplinary committee set up by the Board of Control for Cricket in India met at Mohali , near the northern city of Chandigarh .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-LOC O
Sidhu abandoned the Indian team after the third one-day international against England at Old Trafford in Manchester on May 26 , before India began a three-test series , citing serious differences with captain Mohammed Azharuddin .|||B-PER O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O
Sidhu was not considered for the four-nation Singer Cup beginning in Sri Lanka this month and the Sahara Cup against Pakistan scheduled to be played in Canada next month .|||B-PER O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O B-LOC O O O O O B-LOC O O O
Sidhu , whose ban ends on October 14 , will be free to play domestic cricket .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He will not be considered for a test match against Australia starting on October 10 in New Delhi , the United News of India said .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

RUGBY UNION - All Blacks relive triumph .|||B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O O O
PRETORIA , Aug 25 - Captain Sean Fitzpatrick and his All Blacks revisited the test venue today to relive some of the magic moments of yesterday 's momentous rugby victory over South Africa , NZPA reported .|||B-LOC O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O B-ORG O O
Most of the test 15 who beat the Springboks 33-26 to secure New Zealand 's first-ever rugby series in South Africa stood in the middle of the empty 50,000-seat Loftus Versfeld .|||O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
Magnificent , ' ' said Fitzpatrick , New Zealand 's most capped player and the world 's most capped forward .|||O O O O O B-PER O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O
The players relived the moves and tries , the tackles and what might have been as the emotions of victory continued .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Zinzan Brooke , the only No 8 in test rugby to have scored a dropped goal when he kicked a three-pointer against England during last year 's World Cup , added a second to his name yesterday .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O
The maul was there and I was going to go in but I thought I should hold off because we had the ball .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When ( halfback ) Justin Marshall got the ball he was going to go on the openside where Jon Preston was so I emptied my lung at him to get the ball this way .|||O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I just hit through and I was punching the air before the ball got there .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It cost me a few bucks at the bar . '|||O O O O O O O O O O O
'|||O
The decision to attempt a dropped goal was a spontaneous one , Brooke said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
It was just like the World Cup , the ball came and the chance was there . '|||O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O
'|||O
We were gutted and there was nowhere to hide , they just kept coming at you , ' ' he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I was gone in the first 20 minutes , completely exhausted , but you had no choice .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
There was just so much riding on it .|||O O O O O O O O O
It 's amazing just how big this ground was yesterday . '|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
'|||O
Two-try winger Jeff Wilson said he was so tired that he kept asking Bunce where he should be while defending .|||O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O
He told me I 'm buggered too so just hang in there ' , ' ' Wilson recalled .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
About 4000 New Zealander supporters were partying into the early hours of today in the South African capital .|||O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O
Messages of goodwill continued to roll into the team hotel .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
All Blacks coach John Hart said Prime Minister Jim Bolger rang him today to offer his congratulations .|||B-ORG I-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O
He thanked us on behalf of the country , which is really nice for the team , and I understand we had tremendous support at home . '|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
'|||O
