South Africa yet to hear from apartheid enforcers .|||B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O
Anton Ferreira|||B-PER I-PER
South Africa 's truth commission begins issuing subpoenas this week in a bid to dig beneath the political rationales and find the sinister figures who have the blood of the country 's race war on their hands .|||B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Leaders of the major parties involved , from right-wing whites to radical blacks , appeared before Archbishop Desmond Tutu 's Truth and Reconciliation Commission last week to paint the broad picture of their actions for or against apartheid .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Most , including former president F.W. de Klerk and African National Congress Deputy President Thabo Mbeki , offered apologies for any mistakes they had made and accepted broad responsibility for the actions of their foot soldiers .|||O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Human rights lawyer Brian Currin said the hearings last week were not intended as a form of confessional and that those who personally committed crimes during apartheid would testify only before a separate arm of the commission , the amnesty committee .|||O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" I do n't think one should have expected more than what one got , " he said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
That was not the amnesty committee where perpetrators are expected to open their hearts and souls and to tell it all . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The commission , which has the power to grant amnesty to those who confess to abuses , has begun hearing the testimony from people already in jail for their deeds .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tutu 's deputy chairman , Alex Boraine , told reporters the commission would begin issuing subpoenas to suspects who refused to appear voluntarily some time this week .|||B-PER O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But Currin , who is advising several people regarded as perpetrators , said this was not the best way to achieve the commission 's aims .|||O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At the moment this is not the case . "|||O O O O O O O O O O
He cited Coetzee , who was charged with murder after confessing in media interviews to dirty tricks .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Currin said the law had to be changed so all judicial prosecutions were automatically suspended for those who approached the truth commission .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Last week 's submissions to the commission by the ANC , de Klerk 's National Party and the right-wing Freedom Front of General Constand Viljoen left many South Africans unsatisfied .|||O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-PER I-PER O O B-MISC I-MISC O O
Boraine said the picture was incomplete because officers of the apartheid-era security forces had yet to make their scheduled , separate submission , but one black caller to a radio talk show declared :|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
What the people expect is to have houses , to have jobs . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Political scientist Jannie Gagiano said he doubted that the National Party , which implemented apartheid in 1948 and began dismantling it in 1990 , felt it carried a burden of guilt and needed to be exculpated through the commission .|||O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
One has to feel a bit guilty to feel the need for reconciling yourself to a historical adversary , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Professor Tom Lodge of the University of the Witwatersrand demurred , saying :|||O B-PER I-PER O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O
" In the irritation , in the jokes , in the anger that white South Africans express about the commission , I think there 's a moral uneasiness , and I think that 's healthy .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Responsibility is percolating downwards . "|||O O O O O O
Samir Arnaut|||B-PER I-PER
The refugees , rallying in Matuzici on government territory two km from Doboj in northeast Bosnia , waved banners calling the polls a farce staged by the United Nations and the European Union . "|||O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG O O
We demand to vote in Doboj , " other banners said .|||O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O
Bosnia 's Moslem-led central government and many displaced Moslems are angered by a key provision of the Western-organised September 14 elections allowing people to vote in post-war " new places of residence . "|||B-LOC O B-MISC O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As a result , separatist Serb authorities have packed former Moslem majority towns with refugees of their own or registered other Serbs to vote there .|||O O O O O B-MISC O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O
" Only our physical presence in Doboj will mean that the Dayton peace treaty has truly been implemented , " Edhem Efendija Camdzic , Doboj 's Islamic imam-in-exile , told the refugees .|||O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER O B-LOC O B-MISC O O O O O O
" The main point of this rally is to highlight to the world powers what misfortune they brought upon us , " said Reuf Mehemdagic , head of Doboj municipality-in-exile .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O B-LOC O O
How can we then expect the reintegration of Bosnia ?|||O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
But no one will stop us from returning to our homes . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This is a protest of warning and the next step is entering our town using all means possible , so let them shoot . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bosnian Vice President Ejup Ganic , a Moslem , told the refugees : " We have a message for the Serbs who are now in our homes not to plan the future of their children there because there will be no good fortune in that . "|||B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
To loud applause , he added : " We will enter Doboj , untie the Doboj knot and ensure free movement for all .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O
We have to enter Doboj to free the Serbs from their own ( separatist ) politics . "|||O O O O B-LOC O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O
The Dayton peace accords guaranteed refugees the right to return to their homes and ensured freedom of movement across ethnic lines .|||O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
NATO-led peace troops beefed up their presence in the Doboj area on Sunday to deter any sudden emotional attempt by the refugees to cross the Inter-Entity Boundary Line into Doboj .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O
But the crowd dispersed without incident .|||O O O O O O O

The number of casinos has soared in Moscow since the collapse of communism .|||O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O
The mayor has said he wants to cut their number to five as part of a war against organised crime .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Russian troops start pullout , but not in Grozny .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O B-LOC O
SHATOI , Russia 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
Russian troops began to pull out from southern Chechnya on Sunday under a ceasefire agreement between Russian security chief Alexander Lebed and rebel leaders .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O O O O
But in the capital Grozny , the commander of Russian Interior Ministry forces in Chechnya , General Anatoly Shkirko , told Interfax news agency he was delaying a pullout of troops there after a group of Chechens disarmed an armoured column .|||O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-MISC O O O O B-LOC O O B-PER I-PER O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O
Reuters cameraman Liutauras Stremaitis said a column of around 40 vehicles , including tanks , armoured personnel carriers , artillery cannons and lorries , escorted by Chechen rebels , pulled out of the village of Shatoi towards the border , around 50 km ( 31 miles ) to the north .|||B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In Grozny , Shkirko told Interfax he was suspending the pullout of troops from the capital until weapons seized by the Chechens were returned .|||O B-LOC O B-PER O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O
Chechen rebel spokesman Movladi Udugov confirmed the weapons had been seized but that it was a maverick group of Chechens .|||B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O
He said later that the rebels had handed them over .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
The pullout of the Russian troops is a key element of the peace plan brokered by Lebed , which aims to end the 20-month Chechnya conflict .|||O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O B-LOC O O

Leftist Mexican armed group says troops in capital .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O
MEXICO CITY 1996-08-25|||B-LOC I-LOC O
The leftist Popular Revolutionary Army ( EPR ) in a published report on Sunday said it operated throughout Mexico , including the capital , and denied government assertions it was isolated to one state .|||O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Commanders " Vicente " and " Oscar " , guarded by a dozen EPR gunmen , said in an interview with La Jornada outside Mexico City that the armed group was committed to overthrowing the government .|||O O B-PER O O O B-PER O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
" They ( government officials ) want to present us before public opinion as a local problem , as just being from Guerrero and as irrational radicals , " Commander Oscar told La Jornada .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-PER O B-ORG I-ORG O
They said the ERP , whose fighters first appeared wearing military fatigues and brandishing assault rifles in the southwestern state of Guerrero on June 28 , had a 23,000-strong membership , but this could not be confirmed independently .|||O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
La Jornada also reported on Sunday that the Mexican Army has discovered a 37-page , EPR manual detailing guerrilla tactics and strategies .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O
It quoted the manual as saying : " The objective of the Basic Course on War is to provide for combatants of the EPR basic military knowledge for the armed conflict against the police and military apparatus of the bourgeoisie . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It was the second time armed " commanders " of the EPR have granted interviews outside Guerrero state , an extremely poor and volatile region where leftist protesters often have clashed violently with authorities .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Unlike the better known and unrelated Zapatista rebels in southeastern Chiapas state , the EPR has never taken on the army in direct combat , according to official reports .|||O O O O O O B-ORG O O O B-LOC O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Unidentified gunmen dragged 10 men out ot their homes in a rural area of Colombia 's northwest province of Antioquia and shot them to death , authorities said on Sunday .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
Police said the killings occurred on Saturday morning in the municipality of Anza but news of the massacre only reached the provincial capital of Medellin early on Sunday .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O
Anza is only 20 miles ( 30 km ) west of Medellin , but there are no roads linking it directly to the city .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Two Thai border police wounded by Burma gunmen .|||O B-MISC O O O O B-LOC O O
MAE SOT , Thailand 1996-08-25|||B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O
Two Thai border policemen were seriously wounded on Sunday when members of a Burmese rebel splinter faction ambushed their patrol in northwest Thailand , security officers said .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O
The Thai army commander in the area , Col Suvit Maenmuan , told reporters the DKBA , which is allied with the Rangoon military government and based in southeast Burma , had recently stepped up cross-border infiltration .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O
Suvit said the motive for their intrusions was not clear but he had ordered reinforcements to beef up security along the porous frontier .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The DKBA was formed in late 1994 by hundreds of guerrillas who split from the anti-Rangoon Karen National Union ( KNU ) and allied themselves with Burmese government army , their former enemies .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O
DKBA members have since launched intermittent cross-border attacks on Karen refugee camps in Thailand , where the majority of inhabitants are KNU supporters , and on Thai villages and police posts near the border .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O
Bangkok has complained to Rangoon about the raids but Burmese military authorities say they have no contol over the faction .|||B-LOC O O O B-LOC O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O
Thai army commanders reject the explanation , saying they have evidence the Burmese army supplies and directs the renegade ethnic minority splinter faction .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O
JERUSALEM 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O
" A U.S. F-14 military plane while landing at Ben Gurion airport blew a wheel and a fire broke out , " said spokesman Yehiel Amitai , adding that the two pilots on board were not injured .|||O O B-LOC B-MISC O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Airport officials declared an emergency situation at the highest level and the fire brigade put out the flames while the plane was landing , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Egypt hopes jars will reveal secrets of mummies .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O
CAIRO 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O
Archaeologists in Egypt have found pots used by ancient Egyptians in burial rites that they say may reveal the secrets of mummification .|||O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Saleh said the team -- from New York 's Metropolitan Museum -- found four Canopic jars and two unguent jars in the tomb , which belongs to an unidentifed person who lived during the 12th Dynasty ( 1991-1786 BC ) in the Middle Kingdom .|||B-PER O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC I-LOC O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O B-MISC O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
" This finding is important because one of the jars still contains substances and materials used in the conservation of mummies and the conservation of the intestines and all the things which were in the cavity of a person we have not identified yet , " Saleh said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
" We hope that the analysis of such substances and liquids will reveal some secrets of the mummification process and materials used in this process , " he added .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

The Yedioth Ahronoth daily reported that Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu , who has said he has no desire to hold talks with the Palestinian president , opposes the meeting due to be held this coming week .|||O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The newspaper said Weizman scheduled the meeting at his private residence in the central Israeli village of Caesarea after Arafat sent him an emotional appeal " to save the peace process " .|||O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-LOC O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O

" I am prepared to postpone the meeting under one condition -- that you give me a commitment right now to meet Arafat yourself within 10 days , " the paper quoted Weizman as telling Netanyahu .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O B-PER O
It said Netanyahu had yet to give Weizman an answer .|||O O B-PER O O O O B-PER O O O

Corporate America taking new view on compensation .|||O B-LOC O O O O O O
Anne Murray|||B-PER I-PER
NEW YORK 1996-08-23|||B-LOC I-LOC O
Corporate America is planning major changes in employee compensation in the next few years , according to a recent study .|||O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Presently , for example , if an accountant 's job involves doing five specific tasks , he or she can expect a certain salary , said Sandra O'Neal , a Towers Perrin principal .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O B-ORG I-ORG O O
In addition to using accounting skills , the accountant will also have to be creative , work well in a team , be sensitive to customer needs and set productivity goals .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" The good news is , if you 're highly skilled and have many abilities , you 'll be paid more , " said O'Neal .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O
" The bad news is , if you 're not skilled and ca n't contribute to a team , to customer service and the organisation 's goals , you 'll be paid less . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Next on the agenda for these firms is developing a new compensation structure , and 78 percent report that they are considering a new , skills-based plan for both management and non-management employees .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
This coming shift , O'Neal said , " is not just isolated or a fad .|||O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O
It 's an inexorable change . "|||O O O O O O O
After World War II , corporations adopted a " military model " creating hierarchical organisations where " the concept of defined tasks worked great , " she said .|||O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Multi-layers kept management at a distance from its customers , " O'Neal said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
If your team does well , you 'll do well .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
Is this fair to an employee who can go the distance but is on a team that ca n't keep up ?|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" That 's an important question we used to ask a lot , " said O'Neal . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
It 's not a question we ask any more .|||O O O O O O O O O O
To get those results , 27 percent of the companies surveyed plan to eliminate base pay increases in favour of cash bonuses and incentives , such as employee and team award programmes and education .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
For example , the survey rated some participants in the survey as " high-performing " companies , based on their return on equity above 16 percent .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Those companies also said they already offer employees variable pay and business education , give their managers more control over pay decisions and celebrate employee and team success .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" They respect employees more , they trust employees more and they value their employees more , " O'Neal said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
" The key to success at high-performance companies is engaging employees in a business partnership .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It will improve a company 's bottom line . "|||O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

BATKIVSHCHYNA COLLECTIVE FARM , Ukraine 1996-08-26|||B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O
Four shiny new green-and-yellow John Deere combines parked at this 1,750-hectare ( 4,325-acre ) farm in the grain-growing regions south of Kiev do n't fill its chief agronomist with enthusiasm .|||O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O
" They did a good job this year , but they need good diesel and good engine oil , " said Ivan Odnosum . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O
God help us if there is a breakdown , " he said of the machinery , loaned to the farm after the Ukrainian government bought it earlier this year .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O
The country 's grain harvest this year is forecast to fall by more than 23 percent to only 28 million tonnes and two harsh factors are to blame .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A drought scoured the steppes in May and June , stunting the growing wheat .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
And the farming sector , making the painful transition from Soviet central planning to a market economy simply has no money .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O
Ukraine 's black soil is so fertile that a diplomat described it as " rich enough to grow rubber boots " .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But recently Ukraine has been losing its reputation as a breadbasket of Europe , earned in the years before brutal forced collectivisation under Soviet dictator Josef Stalin .|||O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O
" The wheat will not be of a good quality this year , " said Hryhory Borsuk , a scientist at the Mironivka Wheat Institute , run by the Ukrainian Academy of Agrarian Sciences .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O
" The temperature on the ground reached 62 decrees Celsius ( 143.60 Fahrenheit ) this summer .|||O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O
We 've never seen anything so bad , " he said in an interview in his office , unlit since the government cut off electricity because of unpaid power bills .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
While Mironivka 's scientists , some unpaid for months , carry on developing new strains of wheat resistant to Ukraine 's extreme continental climate , Borsuk said the lack of cash in Ukraine 's agricultural sector is as bad as the drought .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O
Collective farms and Ukraine 's nascent private farming sector have no money for fertiliser , no money for herbicides and pesticides , no money to repair old or buy new machinery , no money for fuel , and none to buy good seed .|||O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Chief Accountant Natalya Sypron said the collective is strapped for cash , earlier this year bartering 220 tonnes of grain for diesel to fuel six rickety grain combines and tractors badly in need of repairs and basic maintenance .|||O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The average family earns 160-200 million karbovanets a year ( $ 800 - $ 1,000 ) -- but many have not been paid in months , Soprun said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
People are working out of their own dedication . "|||O O O O O O O O O O
Borsuk said the farm sector has two options : " We can sit down and cry , or we can do something . "|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Planted in late summer and early autumn , the grain is Ukraine 's largest export item and traditionally grows better than summer wheat in Ukraine 's soil .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O
Further plans , he said , called for full provision of resources like fertiliser and herbicides for 25 percent of Ukraine 's arable land next year , for 50 percent in 1998 and 100 percent of the land in 1999 .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" If we follow this we 'll be able to sell 10 million tonnes of grain by the year 2000 , " Borkus said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
The government has been trying to phase out huge subsidies to the farm sector , and in a move back to pre-Soviet days has given up to 50 hectares ( 124 acres ) of land to some 36,000 private farmers willing to go it alone .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Collective farms will last for the next few years , because most private farms now only produce enough to feed themselves with maybe a little extra to sell , said one private farmer : " In the future , maybe , but it 's better not to hurry .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Collectivisation brought us a lot of pain .|||O O O O O O O O O

Gencor swells profit despite setbacks .|||B-ORG O O O O O
Melanie Cheary|||B-PER I-PER
JOHANNESBURG 1996-08-26|||B-LOC O
Announcing the group 's results for the year ended June 30 , chairman Brian Gilbertson said : " Happily the strong improvement in financial performance is not an illusion arising from the recent weakness of the rand relative to the dollar . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Gencor raised attributable earnings to 1,803 million rand from 1,003 million rand previously - in dollar terms an increase to $ 469 million from $ 279 million - and won despite the group 's Impala Platinum Holdings Ltd posting dismal results .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O
" Not everything has gone well .|||O O O O O O O
We 've had substantial production difficulties at a number of our operations .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The most obvious one with the greatest effect on the corporation was at Impala where we had the furnace failure , " Gilbertson said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
Implats posted year attributable profit of 176 million rand from 281 million previously .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The rand was last bid at 4.5350 against the dollar .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
Nor was Implats the only operation to fail output targets .|||O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O
It forfeited nearly one million tonnes of production to flooding at its mines in Mpumulanga province .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O
" The big disappointment for the year was the failure of the platinum merger .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Looking ahead to the current financial year , he said that Gencor would boost earnings further .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O
" Gencor is well placed to take up the challenges of the future .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O
The group is soundly structured and prudently financed and is blessed with an excellent portfolio of world-class businesses .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Citing the disposal of Gencor 's stake in industrial holdings group Malbak Ltd for one billion rand among other smaller disposals , Gilbertson said Gencor had pruned its portfolio to concentrate on core assets .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-PER O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O
" We 've tried to clean up our overall portfolio by disposing of non-core assets .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The biggest of those was Malbak .|||O O O O O B-ORG O
Referring to Gencor 's increased 41.5 percent stake in Ingwe , Gilbertson said the group would wait for coal shares to be cheaper before considering snapping up more .|||O O B-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When we bought the shares we bought ...|||O O O O O O O O
maybe if we just wait another few years for the next downturn in coal . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Finally , Gilbertson said a growing proportion of Gencor 's income was coming from offshore and unlisted investments .|||O O B-PER O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O
-- Johannesburg newsroom +27 11 482-1003|||O B-LOC O O O O
Advanced Medical buying IVAC Medical .|||B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O
SAN DIEGO 1996-08-26|||B-LOC I-LOC O
Advanced Medical Inc. said Monday it will buy IVAC Medical Systems Inc. , a former Eli Lilly & Co .|||B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O
unit , for about $ 400 million in cash , creating one of the world 's largest makers of intravenous infusion therapy products .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Under the agreement , IVAC and Advanced Medical 's wholly owned subsidiary , IMED Corp. , will merge to form a new company that will develop and manufacture infusion pumps that regulate the amount of intravenous fluid being administered to a patient , as well as proprietary disposable products .|||O O O O B-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The combined company will have estimated revenues of $ 353 million .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
Advanced Medical , through IMED , is already one of the nation 's largest developers and manufacturers of intravenous infusion pumps and proprietary disposable products .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It has manufacturing plants in San Diego ; Creedmoor , N.C. ; Hampshire , England ; and Tijuana , Mexico , and distributes its prodcuts in more than 120 countries .|||O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O B-LOC O B-LOC O B-LOC O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
Eli Lilly sold IVAC on Dec. 31 , 1994 to DLJ Merchant Banking Partners LP , River Medical Inc. and other investors .|||B-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O
Advanced Medical said it expects to take an unspecified one-time charge to pay for the merger .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" The addition of IVAC is expected to contribute to financial results in the full second quarter of 1997 , " the companies said .|||O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The merger will add to both companies ' historical leadership in infusion therapy and technology-based drug delivery devices , they said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In 1968 , IVAC introduced the world 's first infusion therapy monitoring device .|||O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O
A year later IVAC improved its system with the addition of an IV pump that regulated the flow of liquids through positive pressure .|||O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
IMED had profits of $ 1.7 million , or 6 cents per fully diluted common share , on $ 53.9 million in revenues in the first half of 1996 .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Excluding the effect of a one-time restructuring charge of $ 17.4 million , IVAC had net income of $ 4.2 million on net sales of $ 112.8 million for the 1996 first half .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Advanced Medical reported profits of $ 8.4 million on sales of $ 29.2 million in the quarter ended June 30 .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The deal is expected to close by the first quarter of 1997 , subject to regulatory approval .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

NEW YORK 1996-08-26|||B-LOC I-LOC O

Other shares were slightly lower , mirroring bonds .|||O O O O O O O O O
The Dow was up eight to 5,731 , while the NASDAQ Index was off fractionally to 1,143 and the S&P Index down one to 666 .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O

RUGBY LEAGUE - ST HELENS CLINCH SUPER LEAGUE TITLE .|||B-MISC I-MISC O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O
ST HELENS , England 1996-08-26|||B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O
St Helens completed their first league and Challenge Cup double in 30 years on Monday when they thrashed Warrington 66-14 to clinch the inaugural Super League title .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O
St Helens secured the two points they needed in the last game of the season at Knowsley Road to win their first championship since 1975 and their first double since 1966 .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In rain-soaked conditions , centre Alan Hunte grabbed a hat-trick of tries , while Tommy Martyn , Anthony Sullivan and Paul Newlove each scored two .|||O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O
Captain and goalkicker Bobbie Goulding scored 18 points .|||O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O
St Helens 's triumph marked the end of Wigan 's seven-year reign as British champions .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O B-MISC O O
They were also the toast of London Broncos , who managed to scrape into the top four ahead of Warrington and qualify for the end-of-season play-offs .|||O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O
Bradford finished third .|||B-ORG O O O
St Helens have now set their sights on taking the treble by winning the end-of-season premiership which begins with next Sunday 's semifinal against London .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O

RALLYING - MAKINEN STEPS UP TITLE BID WITH LAKES WIN .|||O O B-PER O O O O O B-MISC O O
Tommi Makinen took a significant step towards becoming world rally champion with a brilliant victory in the 1000 Lakes Rally on Monday .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O
Mitsubishi driver Makinen stopped experienced fellow Finn Juha Kankkunen in his tracks on the final day of the 1,452-km rally , doubling his lead on the first two decisive stages .|||B-ORG O B-PER O O O B-MISC B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Kankkunen was runner-up in his Toyota as Finland 's Jarmo Kytolehto produced a remarkable drive to finish third in his Ford .|||B-PER O O O O B-ORG O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O
Maakinen 's and Mitsubishi 's positions were strengthened by the late retirement of Spain 's Carlos Sainz when his Ford gearbox failed .|||B-PER O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O B-ORG O O O
Makinen , with 95 points , now leads his nearest championship rival , Sainz , by 32 points .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O

SOCCER - COSTA RICA AND CHILE DRAW 1-1 IN FRIENDLY .|||O O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O
LIBERIA , Costa Rica 1996-08-26|||B-LOC O B-LOC I-LOC O
Costa Rica and Chile|||B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC
drew 1-1 ( halftime 1-0 ) in a friendly soccer international on|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sunday .|||O O
Scorers :|||O O

Mark Gleeson|||B-PER I-PER
JOHANNESBURG 1996-08-26|||B-LOC O
The tiny islands of the Seychelles failed to make soccer history at the weekend when they bowed out of the preliminary rounds of the African Nations Cup .|||O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O
Trailing fellow Indian Ocean islanders Mauritius 1-0 from the first leg , they were held to a 1-1 draw at home on Saturday despite playing against 10 men for most of the match .|||O O B-LOC I-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The 2-1 aggregate took Mauritius into the group phase of the qualifiers for the 1998 finals , and kept up the Seychelles ' record of never having won an official match in their 10 years of FIFA membership .|||O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O
The Seychelles must have thought they were on course for a historic breakthrough when Mauritian midfielder Andre Caboche was sent off for a crude tackle in the 19th minute .|||O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
Mauritius now play in group seven of the qualifiers against Malawi , Mozambique and favourites Zambia .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O B-LOC O
Namibia , who drew 0-0 with Botswana in their first leg , won the second leg in Windhoek 6-0 to stretch their unbeaten run to eight matches and continue their remarkable progress on the African soccer stage .|||B-LOC O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O
German-based striker Bachirou Salou returned home to Togo to score the decisive only goal of their tie against Congo .|||O O B-PER I-PER O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
Ethiopia needed a penalty shoot-out in Addis Ababa to overcome Uganda after a 2-2 aggregate scoreline .|||B-LOC O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O B-LOC O O O O O O
Both legs ended 1-1 before Ethiopia won the spot kick decider 4-2 .|||O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O
Uganda 's elimination follows their humiliating 5-1 aggregate defeat by Angola in June 's World Cup qualifying preliminaries .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O
The other preliminary round second leg match , between Mauritania and Benin in Nouakchott , was postponed until Friday .|||O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O
Benin won the first leg 4-1 .|||B-LOC O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

SWIMMING - POPOV IN `SERIOUS CONDITION ' AFTER STABBING .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O O
Russian double Olympic swimming champion Alexander Popov was in a serious condition on Monday after being stabbed on a Moscow street .|||B-MISC O B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O
" His condition is serious , " said Rimma Maslova , deputy chief doctor of Hospital No 31 in the Russian capital . "|||O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC O O B-MISC O O O
Maslova told Reuters she was not an expert in sports medicine , but said it was too early to judge Popov 's chances of returning to competitive swimming .|||B-PER O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O
Popov , who won gold in the 50 and 100 metres freestyle at the recent Atlanta Olympics , was stabbed in the abdomen late on Saturday after an argument with a group of roadside watermelon sellers in south-west Moscow .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
We 're going to be walking soon -- and swimming , " he insisted cheerfully from his bed in the intensive care unit .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It said the row started when Popov and a group of his friends were returning from a party .|||O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
Vitaly Smirnov , president of the Russian National Olympic Committee , said President Boris Yeltsin had given the swimmer Russia 's top award for his Olympic performance . "|||B-PER I-PER O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O B-LOC O O O O O B-MISC O O O
I am not a doctor but I think he is doing all right , " said Smirnov .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O
-DOCSTART-|||O

SOCCER - PLAYERS LEAVE MATCH EARLY TO CATCH PLANE .|||O O O O O O O O O O
RIO DE JANEIRO 1996-08-26|||B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC O
Two key players left a Brazilian championship match early on Sunday because they had to catch a plane to Russia to play with the national team .|||O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O
Sao Paulo midfielder Andre and Santos defender Narciso were both substituted during their teams ' game , taken to Sao Paulo airport and flown to Rio de Janeiro in a private jet chartered by the Brazilian Football Confederation ( CBF ) .|||B-ORG I-ORG O B-PER O B-ORG O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O B-MISC O O
At Rio , they joined up with the national team squad for the journey to Moscow , where Brazil will face Russia in a friendly international on Wednesday .|||O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-LOC O O B-LOC O O O O O O O
The problem arose because the Sao Paulo-Santos clash was selected as the day 's televised live match , forcing it to be put back three hours from the usual kickoff time .|||O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sao Paulo lead the first stage of the championship on goal difference from surprise package Juventude , who beat Internacional 2-1 .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O B-ORG O O
Corinthians , who played in a tournament in Spain last week , also faced a plane marathon as they attempted to keep up with a hectic fixture list .|||B-ORG O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O

TENNIS - QUENCH YOUR THIRST - IF YOU CAN AFFORD IT AT U.S. OPEN .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O
NEW YORK 1996-08-26|||B-LOC I-LOC O
A message on television monitors all around the National Tennis Centre reads : " Due to hot weather please seek shade and drink plenty of fluids " -- sound advice until you check out the price of fluids .|||O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
A small bottle of a garishly-coloured sports drink at the sun-drenched U.S. Open is going for $ 3.75 , while a litre of basic , life-sustaining water will set you back $ 4.00 -- for water ?|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
U.S. Open officials managed to insult most of the male tennis players last week with their controversial handling of the seeding and draw .|||B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
When the tournament began on Monday it was the fans ' turn to be offended .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" That baked lasagna better be good for $ 8.50 , " said New Yorker Rebecca Weinstein , a U.S. Open regular who was eating a sandwich she had brought from home .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC B-PER I-PER O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O
Indeed , a nice glass of chardonnay or white zinfandel was going for $ 4.75 , while an imported beer was just a bit more than the water at $ 4.50 .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
What 's the message here ? "|||O O O O O O O
Maybe they want us to be alcoholics , " Perry joked before lifting her glass of wine .|||O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O
Fans will be shelling out $ 12.50 for a hamburger and a large french fries .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
And that little snack is guaranteed to make you thirsty .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
It must be the cost of flying those rolls over from Tuscany every day that drives up the price of the sandwich .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O

NEW YORK 1996-08-26|||B-LOC I-LOC O
Martina Hingis led a youthful charge and Australian Open finalist Anke Huber and Magdalena Maleeva were fallen seeds on Monday in a hot , sunny opening to the U.S. Open tennis championships .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O B-PER I-PER O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O
The 15-year-old Hingis , seeded 16th , was honoured to play the first match of the season 's last Grand Slam on Stadium Court but happy to hurry off with a straight-sets victory over the 112th-ranked Angeles Montolio of Spain .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O
Hoping for a longer engagement on the cement at Flushing Meadows were the sixth-seeded Huber of Germany and 12th seed Maleeva of Bulgaria .|||O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O B-PER O B-LOC O O O B-PER O B-LOC O
Coetzer , ranked 17th , avenged her defeat to Huber in the Australian Open semifinals by winning 6-1 2-6 6-2 .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O
" I looked at it as not a first round match , just a great challenge for me , " said Coetzer , 24 . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O
I was really concentrating on keeping my own momentum and my own rhythm .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" She is tough to play in that way because she plays very up and down .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Huber , who reached the final a week ago at Manhattan Beach , could only mourn her luck of the draw .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O
" I was n't happy when I saw the draw .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
She was the first non- seeded player , " said the 21-year-old German . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O
It 's always tough to play somebody like that in the first round in a Grand Slam .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O
It was maybe my best first round match in a Grand Slam I ever played . "|||O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O
Monday brought the best out in U.S. Open rookie Aleksandra Olsza of Poland , ranked 110th .|||O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O B-PER I-PER O B-LOC O O O O
The 18-year-old Olsza , last year 's Wimbledon junior champion , celebrated her debut in the main draw of the Open by removing Maleeva 6-4 6-2 .|||O O B-PER O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-PER O O O
The curtain-raising victories by Hingis and Olsza provided a ringing endorsement for the newest wave of women 's players coming up from the junior ranks .|||O O O O B-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Hingis has been working hard on conditioning and has lost eight pounds ( 3.5 kilos ) in advance of the championships .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" There will be tough matches but I hope I can get there , " she said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Then we 'll see if Arantxa will be there , too . "|||O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O
" I was n't scared when I heard that I was playing Maleeva , " said Olsza . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O B-PER O O
I know that if I want to play professional tennis I have to do my best to try to beat her and I ca n't be scared . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" In terms of tennis , I think the junior players are really good now .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a few years , it could change a lot among the top players . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

TENNIS - STICH GLAD HE STAYED AFTER OPEN VICTORY .|||O O B-PER O O O O B-MISC O O
NEW YORK 1996-08-26|||B-LOC I-LOC O
Michael Stich nearly pulled out of the U.S. Open in protest over the men 's seeding fiasco but the former Wimbledon champion was glad he stayed after sweating out a four-set win on Monday over qualifier Tommy Haas .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O
" I still feel it 's embarrassing what happened and I was about to pull out yesterday and say , ' That 's it , ' " said Stich , one of a host of men who cried foul over seeding procedures that forced an unprecedented remaking of the men 's draw last week .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" But there are so many reasons to play , especially spectators and the kids who come out here and want to enjoy watching tennis , that I decided to stay . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In a break from tradition , the Open did not seed in strict accordance with ATP rankings , instead taking into account other factors that raised objections of favourtism toward U.S. players .|||O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O
One prominent player that did not stay for the Open was French Open champion Yvegeny Kafelnikov , who after being dropped three spots from his ATP ranking to a seventh seeding , withdrew and returned home to Russia .|||O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-MISC I-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
Kafelnikov had pulled out of last week 's tournament with a rib injury .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At a news conference attended by approximately 50 players on Sunday , U.S. Davis Cup player Todd Martin expressed the players ' outrage at the seedings .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC B-MISC I-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O
Stich said he felt the players ought to have organised an active protest .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" I feel that we made it a little easy for the USTA .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O
They did n't really get hurt as much as I think they should have , " said Stich . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
He took a positive first step with his 6-3 1-6 6-1 7-5 win over compatriot Haas on a sun-baked Grandstand court .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O B-MISC O O
The suspicion , however , lingers in Stich 's mind that U.S. Open officials did tamper with the seeding process in order to benefit homegrown players .|||O O O O O O O B-PER O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" I get the feeling that everything is done here for the American players and they forget about all the other players , " said Stich , who lost the 1994 Open final to Andre Agassi .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O
It was Agassi who was at the centre of the controversy that engulfed the tournament since the original draw was completed on Wednesday .|||O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" He ( Agassi ) should be seeded the way he is playing tennis right now , " said Stich about the unfairness of moving up Agassi , who made early exits from the French Open and Wimbledon .|||O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O B-MISC O
Stich , not seeded here for the first time since 1990 , might have benefitted from some fiddling with the seedings himself after Kafelnikov withdrew .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O
Ranked 18th in the world , Stich might have been slipped into that spot ahead of Spain 's Felix Mantilla , who is 16th but had never been played in the Open and had been left out of the seedings originally .|||O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O
But Stich did n't want to play that game .|||O B-PER O O O O O O O O
" I think he deserves to be seeded as everybody else who is in the top 16 deserves to be seeded , " Stich said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O

ATLANTA 1996-08-25|||B-LOC O
Brian McRae singled in Tyler Houston in the top of the ninth inning to snap a tie as the Chicago Cubs avoided a three-game sweep with 3-2 victory over the Atlanta Braves on Sunday .|||B-PER I-PER O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O
The Braves scored four runs in the ninth for a 6-5 victory on Saturday .|||O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Kevin Foster ( 5-2 ) won his second straight start , allowing two runs and six hits with two walks and three strikeouts over eight innings .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" The biggest thing was my fastball , I was able to rotate it pretty good , " Foster said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
Also , I was able to keep my changeup down . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
At Colorado , Vinny Castilla homered twice and drove in four runs and Larry Walker went 3-for-4 with a homer and three RBI as the Colorado Rockies outslugged the Pittsburgh Pirates 13-9 in the rubber game of a three-game series .|||O B-LOC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O

He added a three-run homer in the eighth off John Ericks to make it 13-8 .|||O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O

SAN FRANCISCO 1996-08-25|||B-LOC I-LOC O
San Francisco Giants All-Star left fielder Barry Bonds did not appear in Sunday 's 7-2 victory over the Montreal Expos , ending his consecutive games streak .|||B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG B-MISC O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O
After appearing as a pinch-hitter in the previous two games , Bonds , who has been battling a hamstring injury , did not see any action today , ending his streak at 357 consecutive games .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It was the second-longest streak by an active player in the the majors behind Baltimore 's Cal Ripken , who appeared in his major-league record 2,282nd straight game today , a 13-0 loss to the California Angels .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O

KIRKLAND , Wash .|||B-LOC O B-LOC O
1996-08-26|||O
Lamonts Apparel Inc , an operator of 42 family apparel stores in six northwestern states , said it has filed a reorganization plan in bankruptcy court in Seattle .|||B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
( Corrects to make clear a reorganization plan has been filed ) .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The reorganization plan calls for all secured claims to be paid in full .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Of that amount , 4.05 million and 5.67 million shares will be allocated to the company 's trade creditors .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Between 4.75 and 3.13 million shares will be allocated to bondholders and other unsecured non-trade creditors and 200,000 will be allocated to existing shareholders in exchange for all existing stock of the company .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bondholders and other unsecured non-trade creditors will receive warrants four about 2.2 million shares when the company 's market capitalization reaches $ 20 million .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Bondholders , other unsecured non-trade creditors , and existing shareholders also will receive warrants entitling them to roughly 800,000 shares when the company 's market capitalization reaches $ 25 million .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

LONDON 1996-08-26|||B-LOC O
More than 100 people were safely evacuated on Monday from a ferry that caught fire soon after leaving Guernsey in Britain 's Channel Islands , police said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O
Police said the 111 passengers and six crew on board the ferry Trident Seven , owned by France 's Emeraud line , were rescued by a variety of private and commercial boats after fire broke out in the engine room soon after it left port .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O B-LOC O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
An 88-year-old woman was taken to hospital with leg injuries , according to a spokesman for Guernsey police .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O
The ferry , which was towed into port , had been bound for Jersey , another in a cluster of small British-ruled islands off north-west France .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-LOC O

SARAJEVO 1996-08-26|||B-LOC O
Bosnia 's election organisers will decide on Tuesday whether or not to postpone municipal elections scheduled as part of nationwide balloting , an OSCE spokeswoman said on Monday .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O
International observers say the alleged irregularities could affect the outcome of voting for municipal assemblies .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Tomorrow ...|||O O O
the Provisional Election Commission will consider the possible postponement of municipal elections only ...|||O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O
the other elections will be held on September 14 , " OSCE spokeswoman Agota Kuperman told reporters in Sarajevo .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O B-LOC O
" I think that it would be very difficult to select which municipal elections would have to be cancelled .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
I think probably if the decision ( to cancell ) were to be taken it would probably be all municipal elections ..|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
. "|||O O
Kuperman added that options other than postponement were also on the table , but she refused to specify what they were .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The Dayton peace agreement gave the OSCE a mandate to organise Bosnian elections .|||O B-LOC O O O O B-ORG O O O O B-MISC O O
The Provisional Election Commission is OSCE 's top rule-making body for the poll .|||O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-ORG O O O O O O O O
Balloting inside Bosnia is scheduled for September 14 , when citizens are slated to elect municipal and cantonal assemblies , separate Moslem-Croat and Serb parliaments , a national House of Representatives and a three-man Presidency .|||O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-MISC O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O
A Sarajevo daily newspaper , Dnevi Avaz , which is close to Bosnia 's Moslem nationalist SDA party , on Monday said the OSCE would postpone the municipal-level elections until the Spring of 1997 because of the refugee registration problems .|||O B-LOC O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-LOC O B-MISC O B-ORG O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
SDA has a representative on the Provisional Election Commission .|||B-ORG O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O
" I do n't know what the source of the Dnevi Avaz report is , but it is consistent with what I have heard from western diplomats and from inside the OSCE , " said an OSCE staff member in Sarajevo who asked not to be named .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O B-ORG O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O
Ambassador Robert Frowick , an American , heads the OSCE mission in Bosnia .|||O B-PER I-PER O O B-MISC O O O B-ORG O O B-LOC O
OSCE and independent monitors allege that Serb authorities have systematically discouraged refugees from registering to cast a ballot in the places they lived before the war .|||B-ORG O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Instead , the refugees were said to have been directed by their authorities to vote from strategic towns which had Moslem majorities before the 43-month Bosnian war , but which are now underpopulated as a result of " ethnic cleansing " .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Diplomats explain the purpose of this electoral engineering is to secure Serb control over pivotal towns inside the 49 per cent of Bosnia known as the Serb republic , consolidating through the ballot box what was initially taken in war .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The top U.N. refugee official in the Balkans highlighted the voter registration problem on Monday .|||O O B-ORG O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O
" Results of the registration for September elections herald a dismal future for multi-ethnicity in Bosia-Hercegovina , " warned Soren Jessen-Petersen , Special Envoy for the U.N. High Commissioner for Refugees in Former Yugoslavia .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
" In the run-up to elections , nationalistic political leaders are playing the ethnic / sectarian card , drumming up support within their constituencies by playing on bitter memories or fear . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Alexander Lebed may finally get to discuss his Chechen peace proposals with Boris Yeltsin on Tuesday after a lost weekend in the region when he was forced to abandon plans to sign a new political treaty with the separatist rebels .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O B-MISC O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It could be a sobering experience for the Kremlin security chief who , just two months after being appointed by the president and two heady weeks after taking charge of the Chechen crisis , had promised to wrap up the 20-month war by the weekend .|||O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Despite a mood of compromise in the region after some of the worst fighting of the war , Lebed may be just finding out that concluding a long-term settlement , somewhere between rebel demands for independence and Moscow 's insistence that Chechnya remain part of Russia , will be no easy matter .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O B-LOC O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O
He returned at the weekend , pledging to conclude a political settlement that would make this truce work where all others have failed .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
But then he apparently thought better of it .|||O O O O O O O O O
Saying he needed to tidy up legal loose ends on the deal -- and also cover his back against unnamed pro-war schemers in Moscow -- he flew back to the capital empty-handed on Sunday .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O
It was not clear if the start of Yeltsin 's holiday , announced later , would affect plans to talk .|||O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
Moscow 's as yet undisclosed proposals on Chechnya 's political future have , meanwhile , been sent back to do the rounds of various government departments .|||B-LOC O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
It is not known what caused the delay in the peace plan .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Speculation mounted last week that Lebed was operating out on a limb in Chechnya as Yeltsin , hardly seen since his reelection last month , kept out of sight and then gave an interview criticising his envoy just as he clinched a truce .|||O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
If that were the case , it was unclear why Lebed suddenly found it necessary to have the deal verified in Moscow .|||O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O
Maskhadov warned that Lebed risked the same fate as a former Russian army commander in the region who sought a compromise and was blown up last year by -- so the Chechens say -- Russian forces .|||B-PER O O B-PER O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-MISC O O
Maskhadov may also have made new demands on Lebed , forcing him to check back with the Kremlin on what he could offer .|||B-PER O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O
Chernomyrdin said voters should decide Chechnya 's future but stressed there was no question of the government letting the region quit the Russian Federation -- something Moscow fears could encourage separatist tendencies in other ethnic regions , particularly in the strategic North Caucasus .|||B-PER O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
Lebed may be be finding that closing that political gap between the two sides is more difficult than just ending a war .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Russian President Boris Yeltsin began a new summer holiday on Monday but would remain in control of affairs of state , Interfax news agency said .|||B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O
Interfax said Yastrezhembsky did not exclude that Yeltsin could spend some time in other places .|||B-ORG O B-PER O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O
" One must give B. Yeltsin a chance to rest and recover his health after the elections , " Interfax quoted Yastrezhembsky as saying .|||O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O B-PER O O O
" ( Yeltsin ) controls internal and international policies , daily receives a big packet of documents from Moscow , which demand his intervention ...|||O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O
Many of those documents return to the president 's administration the same day , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Yeltsin went on a two-day trip outside Moscow last week to check out a holiday home .|||B-PER O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O
-DOCSTART-|||O
Yugo Zastava workers ' protest enters 2nd week .|||B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O
BELGRADE 1996-08-26|||B-LOC O
Thousands of workers of Serbia 's Zastava arms factory entered the second week of protests on Monday over unpaid wages and the lack of a programme to revive the plant 's production .|||O O O O B-LOC O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" We are stubborn , have strength and time to persist until our demands are met , " said the factory 's trade union secretary Dragutin Stanojlovic .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O
" We are united and we are waiting for the government to decide what to do with us . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Trade unions demanded payment of June and July wages and last year 's holiday pay , and called on government to develop a revival programme for the plant .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The former Yugoslav national army consumed 90 percent of Zastava 's pre-war output , but like the rest of Yugoslavia 's economy , the new army of Serbia and Montenegro is crippled by lack of funds .|||O O B-MISC O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O
The ruling Socialist Party last week accused Serbia 's opposition of stirring up social unrest and using workers ' already difficult social position for their own interests .|||O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" Late wages , no work and ( the lack of a ) production programme are the main reasons for their protests , " a senior member of the local Socialist Party branch told Reuters .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O B-ORG O
" But there is a significant influence of opposition parties that are collecting points ahead of coming elections . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Federal Yugoslav elections are due on November 3 .|||O B-MISC O O O O O O O
The party official said the union 's figure on the number of protesters was exaggerated . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
" But there were more observers and passers by , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Samuel Graham , who told his family earlier that he was nervous about starting at a new school because he feared teasing about his weight problem , had been due to spend his first day at Parkway Middle School Monday , police said .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O

His father cut him down and tried to revive him but paramedics pronounced him dead when they arrived .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O

U.S. Midwest hog market seen steady Tuesday - trade .|||B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O
CHICAGO 1996-08-26|||B-LOC O
Midwest direct cash hog prices Tuesday were seen steady following strong demand Monday that lifted prices as much as $ 1.50 per cwt in some areas , livestock dealers said .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
The demand was sparked by Saturday 's active slaughter , which left some packers short on supplies to get Monday operations started , they said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Top prices in Iowa / southern Minnesota Tuesday were expected to range from mostly $ 59.50 to $ 60.00 , steady following a $ 0.50 - $ 1.50 jump Monday .|||O O O B-LOC O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Illinois tops were seen matching Monday 's at $ 59.00 with tops in Indiana at $ 57.50 .|||B-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O
However , USDA reported tops of $ 58.00 in Illinois and in Iowa / southern Minnesota , $ 60.00 on some hogs Monday .|||O O B-ORG O O O O O O B-LOC O O B-LOC O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O
Attempts to move prices higher again Tuesday could be offset by expected increased hog marketings this week , sources said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Producers were expected to ship as many hogs as they can ahead of the Labor Day holiday weekend , they said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O
Demand for hogs is expected to be light by the end of the week , as the industry prepares for Labor Day , Monday , September 1 when most U.S. packers will be closed .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O O

Gore presents new image of lead attack dog .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O
Michael Posner|||B-PER I-PER
CHICAGO 1996-08-26|||B-LOC O
No more mild-mannered and meek Al Gore , the vice president and likely heir apparent to President Bill Clinton , emerged on Monday as the new Democratic attack dog leading a front-line assault on Bob Dole and House Speaker Newt Gingrich .|||O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-ORG O B-PER I-PER O
Crowds anxiously wait for his appearances , thrusting out hands for him to grip as they scream " 12 more years " -- a wishful hope to eight years of Gore after a Clinton re-election .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O B-PER O O
Over a 15-hour span from Sunday evening to Monday morning , so many people jammed Gore events that the fire marshal stopped members of Congress , reporters and others from entering a pro-Israel rally and a meeting of the New York delegation .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O
In his appearances , the often stiff and wooden Gore seemed transformed into a new energetic , gesturing " pol " as he ripped into Republican presidential nominee Dole and Gingrich , who has emerged as the favorite right-wing foil of Democrats .|||O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O
Gore told a roaring labor rally of about 1,000 union workers that Dole and Gingrich were the virtual personifaction of evil , without even mentioning that former Housing Secretary Jack Kemp is Dole 's running mate .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O B-PER O O O O
" With equal measures of ignorance and audacity this two-headed monster of Dole and Gingrich has been launching an all out assault on decades of progress of behalf of working men and women , " Gore said to whoops of " 12 more years . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O
" They want to drive you out of politics and they ca n't , " he added . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
At a downtown hotel Monday , the 48-year-old Gore gave Wisconsin delegates a taste again of the new Gore .|||O O O O O O O O B-PER O B-LOC O O O O O O O B-PER O
" I want you to ask this question .|||O O O O O O O O O
What would Wisconsin face if the same extremist coalition , the Gingrich / Dole Congress , also controlled the executive branch ? "|||O O B-LOC O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O
Gore said .|||B-PER O O
Noting the next presidential term will probably see two or three Supreme Court justice nominations , he warned , " Their extremist agenda would come out of the Gingrich Congress , into and through the Dole White House , down through the Supreme Court . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O O
He painted a scene of horrors he saw if Republicans controlled the White House and the Congress they hold now . "|||O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O B-LOC I-LOC O O B-ORG O O O O O
Medicare would be at risk of withering on the vine .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O
Medicaid would be at risk of being taken away from poor children .|||B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O
Education would be at risk .|||O O O O O O
The environment would be at risk from the polluters that control that coalition , " he said .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
His new style mixed an assault on Republicans with what he sees as " productive opportunity , a vision for the future that lifts up working families , that builds Wisconsin stronger , that builds America stronger .|||O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-LOC O O
With your help we can re-elect Bill Clinton . "|||O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O
Dole 's tax cut plans were called " deja-voodoo economics .... It 's a warmed-over plan that failed and drove our economy into a ditch .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
We got burned once and we wo n't let that happen to our nation again . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Gore ridiculed Dole 's defense of the tobacco industry , praised Clinton for " courage " in advancing regulations of it .|||B-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O
To the delegates of Wisconsin , a leading dairy state , Gore had the right audience in poking fun at Dole 's comparison to addiction to tobacco to those who ca n't tolerate milk .|||O O O O B-LOC O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
He praised Clinton for vetoing the Republican Congress ' attempt to repeal parts of the Clean Air Act , and criticized Republicans for " slashing money to combat drugs in schools . "|||O O B-PER O O O B-MISC B-ORG O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O
" The choice has never been starker , the stakes today have never been higher , " Gore said . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
We 're not going to let them get away with that . "|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O

Actor Reeve highlights Democrats ' first night .|||O B-PER O B-MISC O O O O
The highlights of the first day of the Democratic convention on Monday were expected to feature a mix of party leaders and people who have overcome adversity .|||O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Richard Gephardt and Sen .|||B-PER I-PER O O O
Thomas Daschle .|||B-PER I-PER O
Here are thumbnail profiles of the convention 's key Monday speakers .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O
Sarah Brady -- The nation 's toughest gun control law is named after Ronald Reagan 's press secretary James Brady but it was his wife who was the major force behind its passage .|||B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
As head of Handgun Control Inc. , Sarah Brady , 54 , campaigned nonstop for tough gun control in the years following the shooting of her husband and then President Reagan in 1981 .|||O O O B-ORG I-ORG I-ORG O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O
Reagan recovered fully from his wounds but Brady , who was close to death after being shot by John Hinckley Jr .|||B-PER O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER I-PER O
, suffered serious brain damage .|||O O O O O O
Before the assassination attempt , she had worked for Republican congressmen and for the Republican Party .|||O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O O B-ORG I-ORG O
Christopher Reeve -- Reeve was best known for playing the comic book hero Superman in four movies but his greatest heroics came in real life .|||B-PER I-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O
Reeve , an accomplished rider who owned several horses , suffered multiple injuries including two shattered neck vertebrae when he was thrown from his horse at an equestrian event in Culpepper , Virginia , on May 27 , 1995 .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC O B-LOC O O O O O O O
Almost entirely paralyzed , Reeve underwent extensive surgery to fuse the vertebrae to the base of the skull and prevent any further damage to his spine .|||O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
That allowed him to be moved to a semi-upright position .|||O O O O O O O O O O O
Over time he regained the power of speech , so much so that he was asked to address the opening night of the Democratic National Convention .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC I-MISC O
Reeve , 43 , was classically trained as an actor but became the prototypical handsome leading man .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Richard Gephardt -- Gephardt , House Democratic leader , is a politician with a " Mr Clean " reputation who sought the presidency eight years ago and is widely believed to still have ambitions for the job .|||B-PER I-PER O B-PER O B-ORG B-MISC O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Gephardt , 55 , the son of a milkman from a working class district of St. Louis , is a consummate congressional insider , sufficiently skilled in compromise and the ways of the legislature to manage the often-unruly House Democrats .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG B-MISC O
He was an opponent of abortion until 1986 and voted for President Ronald Reagan 's big tax cut bill .|||O O O O O O O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O
Gephardt , a red-haired square-jawed man , is a less than fiery orator .|||B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O
Tom Daschle -- Daschle , 48 , was largely unknown outside Washington and his state of South Dakota when he surprisingly beat more prominent rivals to become Senate Democratic leader after the party lost its majority to the Republicans in 1994 .|||B-PER I-PER O B-PER O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O O O O O O O O O B-ORG B-MISC O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O O O
A mild-mannered and youthful man who rose rapidly after entering the Senate in 1987 , he presented himself as a Midwest moderate , as a Democratic winner in a Republican state able to unite Senate factions .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O B-LOC O O O O B-MISC O O O B-MISC O O O O B-ORG O O
Concern that he might be steamrollered by the vastly more experienced Republican leader Bob Dole was dispelled when he showed a tough edge , outmaneuvering Dole in a wrangle over scrapping a gas tax and raising the federal minimum wage .|||O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O B-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O
In his early Senate years he was seen as a " prairie populist " , working on legislation protecting farmers ' prices and also on compensating veterans sickened by Agent Orange defoliant spraying in the Vietnam War .|||O O O B-ORG O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O O O O B-MISC I-MISC O
Daschle was a key player in President Bill Clinton 's failed attempt at sweeping healthcare changes but when he became minority leader he declared he would be no water-carrier for the White House .|||B-PER O O O O O O B-PER I-PER O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O O B-LOC I-LOC O
He has made clear he opposed Clinton 's signing of the Republican-initiated welfare reform bill .|||O O O O O O B-PER O O O O B-MISC O O O O
